● Ability to creatively solve complex problems and propose innovative solutions.

● Ability to rapidly prototype ideas/solutions with a critical/experimental approach to data analysis.

● Good communication skills and ability to translate technical results into insights for non-experts.

● Aptitude for teamwork, with strong orientation toward interdisciplinary collaboration.


NICE TO HAVE:


● Experience with code versioning systems (git).

● Experience in Pyspark development and working in big data platforms.

● Knowledge of at least one major cloud environment (Azure, GCP, AWS).

● Experience in processing and modeling with unstructured data (Text Analytics, Computer Vision)

● Prior analytical experience in the financial industry


EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:


● Master's degree or PhD with excellent grades in Data Science, Statistics, Physics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or related fields

● Experience in a corporate setting (including internships), preferably in finance or insurance


LOCATION:

Milan


WHAT WE OFFER:


COMPENSATION, WELFARE & BENEFIT


Our history, as well as our future, is based on the value of our people. Prometeia’s biggest investment is in our people and it concerns every aspect of professional life. We call it “Total Compensation” and it is made of three elements: Compensation, consisting of a fixed and a variable component, a Welfare Plan active since 2015 –we were among the first companies in Italy to introduce it–, and Benefits, including all initiatives for the well-being of our people.


REMOTE WORKING

Flexibility is an intrinsic value of our way of working. In Prometeia, remote working is an organizational method based on trust. It results in benefits in terms of work/life balance, impact on the environment and optimization of company results through autonomy and empowerment of people.


PEOPLE PROGRAM

Our evaluation system is based on the full enhancement of our people and on continuous dialogue as a stimulus for regular, mutual professional and personal growth. Within the projects, several moments are dedicated to transparent discussions between managers and team members. This allows for reciprocal and prompt feedback. The process is fully digitalized and aimed at continuously improving the strategic growth of both the individual and the company.


TRAINING

Prometeia means continuous training. We provide an average of 11 days of training per year to our people, in person and online. We pay specific attention to younger colleagues, the protagonists of dedicated growth programs, and to the continuous sharing and internal transfer of know-how and skills. On-the-job training is also important and is made of immediate and direct confrontation with the market.


WIN/WIN POLICY

If you are one of our employees and you recommend a person who is later hired, you are entitled to a financial bonus! This is an important opportunity to contribute to the growth of Prometeia as a whole, by attracting acknowledged market professionals and new tech talents.


PHYGITAL MANAGEMENT

We have completely digitalized the management of our physical and virtual environments through the dedicated app Pr(Home)teia. Access to the office, remote working, workstations, meeting rooms, carpooling... everything is just a click away.


COMMUNITY

Our Community is highly diverse, as are the skills of the people who are part of it and who share its values, and the individuals and organizations directly or indirectly involved in our activities. Clients, People of the Group, Alumni, Institutions, Academia, non-profit entities we actively cooperate with are stakeholders representing a great value for us in terms of trust and collaboration.


DIVERSITY

We promote and respect equal opportunities and consider differences as a value. Diversity & Inclusion are fundamental values: from the recruitment phase to everyday life, promoted also through dedicated training moments to develop individual sensitivities and uniqueness.


IMPACT

We responsibly take an active role towards the environment, territories and communities we operate in. Our Headquarter in Bologna has obtained the Leed Gold Certification, one of the highest awards recognizing the efficiency of the building in terms of energy and water savings, CO2 emissions reduction, and improvement of the ecological quality of interiors, materials and resources. In the Sustainability Report we outline the results achieved within the 17 Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) of the 2030 Agenda drafted by the UN in 2016, that we have been supporting since 2020.

Title: AI Developer - MILANO [DIG]
HTML:
Trasforma le tue aspirazioni professionali in una storia di successo, entra in PwC come AI Developer.

Your Perspectives

Entra a Far Parte Del Nostro Team Digital Innovation - AI Center Of Excellence In Rapida Crescita e Partecipa Allo Sviluppo Di Rivoluzionarie Applicazioni Basate Su Tecnologie Di Intelligenza Artificiale. Avrai L’opportunità Di

  • Sviluppare progetti basati su algoritmi di intelligenza artificiale, sia per ottimizzazioni dei processi interni o per clienti che integrati in innovative soluzioni software;
  • Contribuire attivamente alla crescita della nostra struttura dedicata all'Intelligenza Artificiale, in particolare al Natural Language Understanding e alla Computer Vision;
  • Partecipare al ciclo di vita di un prodotto basato su AI, dall’analisi del business case, al tuning dei modelli, allo sviluppo delle componenti applicative richieste dall’applicazione fino alla realizzazione della User Experience ideale;
  • Muoverti in un contesto organizzato, dove gli aspetti metodologici e di relazione assumono una rilevanza strategica con respiro internazionale e multiculturale;
  • Operare in un contesto organizzato, dove gli aspetti metodologici e di relazione assumono una rilevanza strategica con respiro internazionale e multiculturale;
  • Garantire l’erogazione dei deliverables di progetto concordati con il Project Manager di riferimento e con i committenti, in accordo con i vincoli di budget e quality condivisi;
  • Fornire supporto applicativo a soluzioni basate su moduli di Intelligenza Artificiale, Large Language Models e Computer Vision, sia esistenti che di nuova realizzazione.

Your unique strengths

  • Possiedi una laurea in discipline STEM;
  • Hai esperienza nello sviluppo e addestramento di modelli utilizzando tecniche di Machine Learning, Natural Language Processing e Computer Vision, sia a partire dai framework più utilizzati (TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras, Spark ML, Spark GraphX) che da servizi SaaS (Google Vertex AI, Azure Cognitive Services, OpenAI);
  • Hai esperienza nell'utilizzo di Python per lo sviluppo di soluzioni basate su AI e sei interessato a lavorare con Large Language Models come OpenAI e tecniche di Computer Vision come OCR, YoLo, etc.;
  • Hai basi di Semantic Web e conosci l’architettura dei motori di ricerca evoluti (Elastic Search, Solr, Lucene);
  • Hai utilizzato strutture dati NoSQL (MongoDB o componenti dell'ecosistema Hadoop);
  • Conosci approfonditamente linguaggi di programmazione object oriented come Java/Scala, C++ o Python;
  • Sei capace di mettere in pratica tecniche di "Continuous Learning" al fine di cogliere opportunità da nuove tecnologie senza abbandonarti alla sola attività di ricerca;
  • Possiedi tecniche di ascolto attivo, capacità di sintesi e di problem solving;
  • Ti contraddistingui per intraprendenza e curiosità, spiccato senso di responsabilità professionale;
  • Possiedi una conoscenza avanzata della lingua inglese (parlata e scritta).

Set your expectation higher

PwC ti sorprenderà con un’opportunità di carriera che ti farà sentire al centro della società, dell’innovazione e del cambiamento. Il tuo talento e la tua curiosità avranno tutto lo spazio che meritano e, attraverso l’identificazione delle migliori risorse, contribuirai a garantire la qualità dei servizi che offriamo ai nostri clienti. In questo percorso di crescita sarai accompagnato da colleghi esperti e da una formazione continua e su misura grazie alla quale potrai mettere le tue competenze a disposizione dei clienti interni.

Feel at home

Ci prendiamo cura delle nostre persone, abbracciando le diversità e creando valore per i clienti, le persone e la comunità, nel rispetto dell'ambiente. GIVE YOUR LIFE A DIFFERENT PERSPECTIVE

Title: AI Specialist
Description:
GSD Sistemi e Servizi S.C a R.L., società consortile di Gruppo San Donato nata nel 2011 con l'obiettivo di erogare servizi trasversali standardizzati di modo da fare delle singole strutture un vero e proprio gruppo e di passare da una gestione locale a una gestione professionale e centralizzata, è alla ricerca di un/una AI Specialist da unire al team dedicato all’innovazione tecnologica in ambito sanitario/clinico e amministrativo.

Il candidato ideale avrà un forte background tecnico e una profonda comprensione delle applicazioni dell’IA per migliorare l’efficienza, l’accuratezza e la qualità dei servizi sanitari e dei relativi processi amministrativi e operativi. Questa posizione di riporto diretto al CIO di Gruppo offre l’opportunità di contribuire direttamente alla progettazione, conduzione e sviluppo di soluzioni innovative che avranno un impatto positivo sulla vita dei pazienti e sul funzionamento del sistema sanitario ospedaliero in termine di semplificazione di accesso alle strutture, alle cure e all’innalzamento della qualità dei servizi erogati.

Responsabilità principali:

Progettare, sviluppare e implementare modelli di intelligenza artificiale per applicazioni in ambito sanitario, come diagnostica, personalizzazione dei trattamenti, ottimizzazione dei processi ospedalieri, automazione attività e processi e analisi predittiva.
Analizzare grandi set di dati clinici e operativi per identificare pattern significativi e fornire insights utili nel rispetto della legislazione di tale materia indirizzata dalla nuova AI Act.
Collaborare con gruppi multidisciplinari, tra cui medici, biostatistici, ingegneri e manager, per comprendere le esigenze specifiche del settore sanitario e amministrativo associato.
Assicurare l’aderenza a normative e standard di privacy e sicurezza dei dati, come il GDPR, NIS2, e altre regolamentazioni specifiche del settore sanitario.
Monitorare gli sviluppi tecnologici e scientifici nel campo dell’IA e proporre l’adozione di nuove tecnologie e approcci per mantenere l’azienda all’avanguardia.
Formare e supportare il personale interno nell’utilizzo delle soluzioni basate sull’IA.

Requisiti:

Laurea in Informatica, Ingegneria, Matematica, Fisica, Bioinformatica o campi correlati. Preferibile un titolo di studio avanzato (Master o PhD).
Esperienza comprovata nello sviluppo e nell’implementazione di modelli di Machine Learning, Deep Learning e Data Science in contesti di realizzazione e studio ad esempio di Assistenti virtuali, Sistemi di raccomandazione, Diagnosi mediche, Sistemi generativi di realtà aumentata, elaborazioni di linguaggio naturale (NLP) e riconoscimento vocale e facciale.
Nice to have: Conoscenza di linguaggi di programmazione come Python, R o Java, e familiarità con librerie e framework IA (TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn, ecc.) e pattern di riferimento

Dove?

Via Giovanni Spadoli, 4 - Milano




Dettagli contrattuali: assunzione a tempo indeterminato Full Time




Entrare a far parte del nostro Gruppo significa intraprendere un percorso di sviluppo personale e professionale in cui Innovazione, Umanità e Sostenibilità siano i valori guida. Cerchiamo persone entusiaste, che abbiano un approccio proattivo al lavoro, sinceramente interessate al mondo della Sanità e pronte a mettersi in gioco in un contesto dinamico e stimolante.

Show more

Entrare a far parte del nostro Gruppo significa intraprendere un percorso di sviluppo personale e professionale in cui Innovazione, Umanità e Sostenibilità siano i valori guida. Title: MACHINE LEARNING ENGINEER
Description:
Chi cerchiamo

Per la nostra sede di Milano siamo alla ricerca di una persona da inserire come Machine Learning Engineer all’interno del team Data Engineering Office. La struttura ha la responsabilità di definisce sulla base delle specifiche esigenze gli ambienti per lo sviluppo di use case di Advanced Analytics e definisce in coordinamento con Data Science gli strumenti di DataOps, MLOps assicurando un’adeguata adozione e garantendo il rispetto delle normative e procedure di riferimento.

Per quale società

A2A S.p.A.

Ti occuperai di


Implementazione di pipeline di data ingestion e di data preparation
Modellazione e gestione end-to-end dei dati a supporto dei processi decisionali
Collaborazione attiva con il team di Data Scientist per supportare e implementare, attraverso tecniche di MLOps, la messa in produzione di progetti di Machine Learning supervisionato e non supervisionato, Deep Learning, Data Mining e di Intelligenza Artificiale Generativa
Elaborazione di KPI e indicatori di monitoraggio dei progetti (data drift, concept drift, …) 
Partecipazione proattiva all’innovazione e all’ottimizzazione dei processi aziendali, anche tramite scouting di tool di mercato legati al mondo Data Science, Data Engineering e Data Governance


Sei la persona giusta se ti riconosci in questo profilo


Laurea Magistrale in Ingegneria, Informatica, Fisica, Matematica o affini
Esperienza pregressa di 2 anni in ruolo analogo
Ottima conoscenza di Python e SQL 
Conoscenza di Google Cloud, AWS, Power BI, Django 
Gestione di database e data warehouse su larga scala (SQL/NoSQL) e utilizzo di tecnologie Big Data (Spark, …)
Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese
Completano il profilo: orientamento al team working e capacità di interfacciarsi con interlocutori a diversi livelli, pensiero critico e capacità di problem solving


Saranno valutate esclusivamente le candidature inviate tramite il Sito Carriere aziendale.

Ci impegniamo ogni giorno per creare un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo e innovativo, fondato sul rispetto, sull’etica e sulle pari opportunità garantendo la valorizzazione delle diversità. 

La selezione è rivolta a candidati e candidate in linea con le competenze richieste. I dati personali raccolti verranno trattati nel rispetto del Regolamento Ue 2016/679 (GDPR).

Scopri di più sul Gruppo a2a: 

https://www.gruppoa2a.it/it/carriere/nostre-persone

https://www.gruppoa2a.it/it/carriere/benefit-welfare

https://www.gruppoa2a.it/it/carriere/nostre-career-areas

https://www.gruppoa2a.it/it/carriere/diversity

Per conoscere il nostro processo di selezione e prepararti al meglio al colloquio:

https://www.gruppoa2a.it/it/carriere/processo-selezione

https://content.gruppoa2a.it/sites/default/files/2023-03/consigli-iter-selezione.pdf

Title: ML Engineer
Description:
Department

At Sappi, our Digital Transformation team thrives on tackling business challenges by harnessing the power of analytics, AI, and user-centric design. Driven by a passionate group of data and analytics experts, we optimise processes, uncover valuable insights, and empower proactive decision-making to drive success. Join us as we innovate and transform the future

Role and Responsibilities

In this role you will report to the Head of Data Analytics (based in Brussels).

You will be responsible for:

Collaborating with various teams to analyze key business problems and develop innovative ML solutions, continuously delivering valuable output.
Designing and implementing scalable machine learning (ML) and Artificial Intelligence (AI) solutions into daily operations.
Establishing testing, monitoring and continuous improvement of ML processes.
Making relevant, detailed, well-structured data available for analytics
Applying data science best practices focusing on data preprocessing, feature engineering and model evaluation. Enable rapid prototyping and evaluation.

Required Qualifications

Experience developing and optimizing scalable machine learning solutions on cloud platforms (e.g., GCP, Azure, AWS).
Strong expertise in ML operations and coding with Python; knowledge of SQL is a plus.
Excellent collaboration and communication skills, adaptable to both technical and business audiences.
Intellectual curiosity and a degree in a relevant field (e.g., computer science, statistics, mathematics, engineering).
Fluent in English.

Traveling:

It is expected to have some traveling (up to 10%) to the locations of group.

What we offer:

An excellent opportunity to work, learn & grow with us. With our culture of learning & development, you can access thousands of online trainings
A multi-cultural & international environment to share and collaborate with colleagues from more than 68 nationalities in 31 locations globally.
A unique opportunity to join a global wood fibre solution company. We are constantly innovating toward a circular economy working to achieve our sustainability goals & reduce our carbon foot print.
Friendly atmosphere and team-work oriented culture
Work-life balance
Training opportunities

All qualified applicants will be considered for employment, regardless of their race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, pregnancy, neurodiversity, disability, or any other aspect that makes them unique.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Job Location

Brussels

Job Description

Do you want to belong to one of the most advanced Data Science groups in the industry, developing advanced AI, ML and optimization algorithms, and applying Operations Research techniques?

Do you have passion for technology and desire to learn and grow continuously?

A career in IT Data Science & Analytics at P&G will build your Data Science and Analytics skills, develop your ability to influence and think strategically and will provide you a breadth of experience across multiple internal businesses and type of work (whether you do Analytics for Marketing, Sales, Supply Chain).

As a Data Scientist for the Supply Chain you will belong to an award-winning Analytics / Operations Research community that is global in scope, and operates across P&G’s supply chains.

Find out more about IT at P&G at www.youtube.com/watch?v=1ial3aeA9SE .

Your Contribution To P&g’s Success

Our Data Scientists in IT Data & Analytics at P&G are:


Passionate about Analytics: the ability to mine terabytes of data, develop models and algorithms to derive actionable insights, and then translate those insights into business is important in our work. In this role you will provide consulting services to P&G business units in Europe, India, Middle East and Africa; you will use mathematical modelling, decision analysis and simulation to provide business insights to various aspects of the supply network (supply chain design, inventory modelling, capacity analysis, distribution flow and purchasing analytics). You will get to know a wide variety of supply chains and you will influence multi million-dollar decisions. You will act as primary enthusiast for the power of technology, data, and predictive and prescriptive analysis.
Effective communicators, self-driven and able to drive insights into actions that improve business results. Interpersonal and communication skills are crucial to thrive in a multi-functional leadership team. Your job is to communicate complex data or algorithms into simple conclusions that will empower others to act based on the insights you derive.
Technically Capable: Data Scientists “roll up their sleeves”, using data visualization (Spotfire, Tableau), and analytic tools (R, Python, SAS, JMP, Hive/Impala, etc.) to grasp the business building insights in our mountains of data. You should be adept at applying such technologies for solving ad hoc business problems, innovating on potential future solutions, and working with technology partners to translate your innovations into robust, scaled, analytic solutions.


Job Qualifications

YOU ARE THE RIGHT FIT IF YOU ARE/HAVE:


A Master in a quantitative degree (Operation Research, Statistics, Systems Engineering, Decision Sciences, Computer Science, Applied Math, Economics etc.);
English fluency;
Strong technical & analytical skill (R, SAS, SQL, optimization, simulation, predictive modeling etc);
Great leadership skills, problem solving and priority setting;
Excellent collaboration skills and working comfortably across teams;
have passion to transform how decisions are made through adhoc & scaled application of analytics;
preferably have some experience in CPG (FMCG), supply chain, analytics or consulting; can demonstrate success at deriving insight from data and effectively communicating those insights to drive action.


Your Advantages


A fixed contract, with an attractive compensation package;
Competitive pay, including monthly salary, 13th month at the end of the year as well as an annual variable bonus.
A flexible benefits plan to customize to your personal needs and kilometer allowance/public transport reduction;
Hospitalization plan after 6 months of employment, pension plan, life insurance plan, long term illness insurance and stock purchase plan;
Access to Benefits at work platform: A large benefits platform with employee discounts on renowned shops and online commercial platforms as well as on leisure activities and well-known amusement parks;
Working in an international and inclusive environment, with diverse and supporting colleagues.
Continuous self-development via coaching, trainings and a general Growth Mindset working environment;
A vibrant and modern working environment, supporting employees’ wellbeing:
Subsidized company restaurant;
On-site vibrant Café for breaks and less formal meetings;
On-site fitness room and possibility to join regular group sport activities;
Flexibility in terms of working hours and remote working for a good balance between personal needs and the job to be done.
Employee Assistance Program: free professional counseling services, work-life resources, and mental health support.
Supporting employees’ commute: plenty of parking facilities for both cars and bikes, shower facilities, shuttle between Heizel metro and the office, carpooling community.


ARE YOU EXCITED ABOUT THE ROLE? DEEP DIVE INTO P&G AND CHECK THE BELOW INSIGHTFUL LINKS:

HTML:
Job Location

Brussels

Job Description

Do you want to belong to one of the most advanced Data Science groups in the industry, developing advanced AI, ML and optimization algorithms, and applying Operations Research techniques?

Do you have passion for technology and desire to learn and grow continuously?

A career in IT Data Science & Analytics at P&G will build your Data Science and Analytics skills, develop your ability to influence and think strategically and will provide you a breadth of experience across multiple internal businesses and type of work (whether you do Analytics for Marketing, Sales, Supply Chain).

As a Data Scientist for the Supply Chain you will belong to an award-winning Analytics / Operations Research community that is global in scope, and operates across P&G’s supply chains.

Find out more about IT at P&G at www.youtube.com/watch?v=1ial3aeA9SE .

Your Contribution To P&g’s Success

Our Data Scientists in IT Data & Analytics at P&G are:

  • Passionate about Analytics: the ability to mine terabytes of data, develop models and algorithms to derive actionable insights, and then translate those insights into business is important in our work. In this role you will provide consulting services to P&G business units in Europe, India, Middle East and Africa; you will use mathematical modelling, decision analysis and simulation to provide business insights to various aspects of the supply network (supply chain design, inventory modelling, capacity analysis, distribution flow and purchasing analytics). You will get to know a wide variety of supply chains and you will influence multi million-dollar decisions. You will act as primary enthusiast for the power of technology, data, and predictive and prescriptive analysis.
  • Effective communicators, self-driven and able to drive insights into actions that improve business results. Interpersonal and communication skills are crucial to thrive in a multi-functional leadership team. Your job is to communicate complex data or algorithms into simple conclusions that will empower others to act based on the insights you derive.
  • Technically Capable: Data Scientists “roll up their sleeves”, using data visualization (Spotfire, Tableau), and analytic tools (R, Python, SAS, JMP, Hive/Impala, etc.) to grasp the business building insights in our mountains of data. You should be adept at applying such technologies for solving ad hoc business problems, innovating on potential future solutions, and working with technology partners to translate your innovations into robust, scaled, analytic solutions.

Job Qualifications

YOU ARE THE RIGHT FIT IF YOU ARE/HAVE:

  • A Master in a quantitative degree (Operation Research, Statistics, Systems Engineering, Decision Sciences, Computer Science, Applied Math, Economics etc.);
  • English fluency;
  • Strong technical & analytical skill (R, SAS, SQL, optimization, simulation, predictive modeling etc);
  • Great leadership skills, problem solving and priority setting;
  • Excellent collaboration skills and working comfortably across teams;
  • have passion to transform how decisions are made through adhoc & scaled application of analytics;
  • preferably have some experience in CPG (FMCG), supply chain, analytics or consulting; can demonstrate success at deriving insight from data and effectively communicating those insights to drive action.

Your Advantages

  • A fixed contract, with an attractive compensation package;
  • Competitive pay, including monthly salary, 13th month at the end of the year as well as an annual variable bonus.
  • A flexible benefits plan to customize to your personal needs and kilometer allowance/public transport reduction;
  • Hospitalization plan after 6 months of employment, pension plan, life insurance plan, long term illness insurance and stock purchase plan;
  • Access to Benefits at work platform: A large benefits platform with employee discounts on renowned shops and online commercial platforms as well as on leisure activities and well-known amusement parks;
  • Working in an international and inclusive environment, with diverse and supporting colleagues.
  • Continuous self-development via coaching, trainings and a general Growth Mindset working environment;
  • A vibrant and modern working environment, supporting employees’ wellbeing:
  • Subsidized company restaurant;
  • On-site vibrant Café for breaks and less formal meetings;
  • On-site fitness room and possibility to join regular group sport activities;
  • Flexibility in terms of working hours and remote working for a good balance between personal needs and the job to be done.
  • Employee Assistance Program: free professional counseling services, work-life resources, and mental health support.
  • Supporting employees’ commute: plenty of parking facilities for both cars and bikes, shower facilities, shuttle between Heizel metro and the office, carpooling community.

Title: Data Science
Description:
Location: Brussels, Belgium (Hybrid/Remote Options Available)

Employment Type: Freelance/Contract




About the Role

We are looking for a dynamic and skilled Freelance Data Scientist to join our team on a project basis in Brussels. In this role, you will leverage your expertise in machine learning, statistical modeling, and data analysis to deliver actionable insights and innovative solutions for our clients. This is a unique opportunity to work on diverse projects while enjoying the flexibility of a freelance position.




Key Responsibilities

Data Analysis & Modeling: Analyze complex datasets to extract meaningful insights and build predictive and prescriptive models.
Machine Learning: Develop, implement, and optimize machine learning algorithms to solve real-world business problems.
Data Preprocessing: Perform data cleaning, transformation, and feature engineering to prepare datasets for analysis.
Visualization & Reporting: Communicate findings and recommendations through compelling visualizations and detailed reports using tools like Tableau, Power BI, or Matplotlib.
Collaboration: Work closely with stakeholders, including data engineers, analysts, and business leaders, to understand project goals and deliver tailored solutions.
Tool Development: Build and deploy data science solutions, including custom scripts, tools, and APIs for client use.
Compliance: Ensure compliance with GDPR and other data privacy regulations while handling sensitive data.




Required Skills and Qualifications

Experience:

Minimum 3–5 years of experience as a Data Scientist, preferably including freelance or consulting roles.
Proven track record of successfully delivering data science projects.
Technical Expertise:
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or R, with experience in libraries like Pandas, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, or PyTorch.
Strong knowledge of SQL and experience working with databases.
Expertise in machine learning techniques, including supervised and unsupervised learning, and advanced modeling approaches.
Familiarity with big data platforms and cloud technologies (e.g., AWS, Azure, or GCP).
Experience in natural language processing (NLP) or computer vision is a plus.
Soft Skills:
Strong problem-solving and critical-thinking abilities.
Excellent communication skills to present technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Self-motivated with the ability to work independently and meet deadlines.
Regulatory Knowledge: Understanding of GDPR and best practices for handling sensitive data.




What We Offer

Competitive hourly/daily rates based on experience.
Flexible work arrangements, including hybrid or remote options.
Exciting and impactful projects across various industries.
Access to cutting-edge tools, technologies, and methodologies.
A supportive and collaborative team environment.




How to Apply

Are you passionate about turning data into actionable insights and innovative solutions? We want to hear from you!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
О компании и проекте:

Компания-разработчик всемирно известного браузера в поисках специалиста Data Scientist.

Продукт компании стал символом безопасности и инноваций, завоевав доверие миллионов пользователей по всему миру. Он позволяет скрывать информацию о посещаемых страницах, блокировать трекеры и рекламу, а также оснащен инновационной функцией VPN.

Присоединившись к международной команде, вы станете частью ее главной миссии, а Ваш вклад будет важным шагом в создании совершенного продукта, который делает Интернет безопасным и удобным местом для каждого пользователя.

Компания предлагает возможность долгосрочного сотрудничества, где вы сможете развиваться вместе с ней и принести свой вклад в развитие продукта мирового значения.

Вам предлагается удаленное сотрудничество или работа в офисе компании на Кипре, где Вы сможете наслаждаться не только работой, но и потрясающей культурой и теплым климатом.

Задачи на позиции:


Решение прикладных бизнес-задач, связанных с развитием продукта и улучшением пользовательского опыта
Участие в создании инновационного решения: масштабный, многопрофильный проект с использованием современных технологий, таких как computer vision, ML Ops, LLM
Вклад в разработку творческих и комплексных инструментов, направленных на достижение стратегических целей компании



Requirements


1-2+ года опыта в data science / machine learning
Глубокое теоретическое понимание современных архитектур машинного обучения, особенно transformers и neural networks
Подтвержденный опыт разработки и внедрения моделей машинного обучения в производственных средах
Опыт в области математического моделирования и оптимизации
Степень магистра в области прикладной математики, информатики, физики
Английский B1+



Будет плюсом, если у Вас есть:


Опыт развертывания модели на устройстве для мобильных платформ (iOS/Android)
Практический опыт с методами оптимизации моделей (quantization, pruning, distillation)
Опыт в обучении и тонкой настройке LLM
Опыт разработки и внедрения рекомендательных систем
Опыт работы с ограниченными ресурсами ML-сред (edge devices, tiny LLMs)
Понимание технологий обслуживания моделей ML (например, vLLM)



Benefits

Достойная официальная заработная плата, основанная на вашей квалификации и опыте до 5000 EUR gross

100% удаленка или работа в офисе в центре Лимассола, на Кипре

21 рабочий день отпуска + 10 рабочих больничных дней "без справок"

Карьерный рост и профессиональное развитие в быстрорастущем проекте

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
About the Company

Our client is an innovative real estate company committed to enhancing the way people interact with the real estate market. Their mission is to leverage cutting-edge technology to provide exceptional user experiences. They are building a state-of-the-art large language model (LLM) function for their website to revolutionize customer interactions and simplify property searches.




Role Overview

The client is seeking a highly skilled Machine Learning Engineer to develop, implement, and optimize a large language model for their platform. The role involves creating intelligent, user-focused solutions that transform the Real Estate experience. This position is fully remote, requiring availability during EU business hours.




Key Responsibilities

Design, develop, and deploy LLM-based features tailored to the client's real estate platform.
Implement Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) techniques to enhance LLM performance and relevance.
Fine-tune pre-trained models (e.g., GPT, Llama, etc.) to meet specific business and user needs.
Integrate LLM capabilities into the client's website to enable natural language search, chatbot functionality, and personalized property recommendations.
Collaborate with front-end and back-end development teams to ensure seamless integration of AI-powered solutions.
Optimize model performance for speed, accuracy, and cost-efficiency.
Conduct thorough testing and validation to ensure reliability and scalability.
Stay informed of the latest advancements in machine learning and natural language processing.




Key Skills & Qualifications

Proven experience in developing and deploying machine learning and NLP models, particularly large language models.
Strong expertise in Python and ML frameworks/libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Hugging Face Transformers.
Hands-on experience with fine-tuning pre-trained LLMs for specific applications.
Knowledge of Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) and its implementation.
Familiarity with APIs and integration of AI solutions into web applications.
Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Google Cloud, or Azure for deploying ML models.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a results-driven approach.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, especially in remote team environments.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Permanent position only




WHAT IS CREAM ALL ABOUT?

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency…but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.




CREAM’S SPECIAL RECIPE:

1/3 of Personal development
1/3 of Collective Intelligence
1/3 of Intrapreneurship

Bonus ingredient: … Some passionate colleagues 😀




WHAT IS A DATA SCIENTIST AT CREAM?

As Robin, Data Scientist, you will have a key role in the implementation of innovative data models to solve specific business issues. You will be part of a challenging and multidisciplinary team. You will discover various industries.




YOUR TASKS:

You gather business requirements to better understand your client’s needs
You dive in a large amount of data to discover is hidden
You provide data-driven recommendations to the client
Based on your client’s needs, you apply predictive analysis and machine learning
You bring out concrete and predictive models
At the end, you help the business to better optimize the use of their data
data




HOW DO WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT?

You have at least 2 years of experience in Data Science
You want to learn more about Machine Learning, Robotics Process Automation (RPA)…
You are used to work with one of the following technologies : MATLAB, R, SAS, Python, Java …
You have good communication and synthesis skills
You are fluent in French and English; a good knowledge of Dutch is an asset




WHY SHOULD YOU TASTE CREAM/THE LIME FLAVOUR?

A broad diversity of career options: you’re not stuck in a box
You evolve in a learning environment where you can challenge your knowledge with your colleagues
You grow in a company that is at the leading edge of technology
You have the opportunity to bring new ideas to develop a thriving company
We have values we share, live with, experiment every day

We just hire great people and give them the playing field to become awesome!




"THE LITTLE THING THAT CAN MAKE THE DIFFERENCE,

CREAM IS DEVELOPING A DIVERSITY PLAN AND WOULD LIKE THAT ALL ITS MEMBERS REFLECT THE SOCIETY IN ALL ITS DIVERSITY"

Title: Junior Data Scientist (B2B SaaS in Brussels)
Description:
Join Novable, a pioneering force in corporate innovation. We connect startups with the industrial power of corporations to drive meaningful transformation.

Goal

Grow and maintain our cutting-edge database of innovative companies. Improve our Deep Matching technology to match the right startups with client needs.

Key Responsibilities


Work on R&D projects to improve smart crawlers through the use of LLM Agents
Develop efficient data processing pipelines
Develop evaluation processes for quality improvement
Improve our Deep Matching algorithm


Environment


Be part of a forward-thinking company with an inspiring mission to connect innovation with industrial power for global transformation.
Grow your skills by tackling challenging projects with real business impact.
Enjoy a fun work environment in Brussels, surrounded by passionate professionals committed to making an impact.


Profile


Strong Python skills
Familiar with MySQL and MongoDB
Passionate about generative AI and machine learning techniques
Familiar with Python API frameworks: Django, Flask, …
You love to solve problems, you can troubleshoot complex issues
Fun to work with, we take the sense of humour very seriously
Perfectly fluent in EN
Bonus: experience with AWS or other cloud provider


NOVABLE VISION: ENABLE INNOVATION THROUGH STARTUP RELATIONS

Novable is a tech startup active in the corporate innovation space, providing a startup scouting solution made of advanced technology software and dedicated analyst reviews. In particular, Novable develops an advanced AI-based technology to scout and match startups.

Startups have the innovation power - We believe that startup ecosystems (entrepreneurs, startups, scaleups, hubs, accelerators, venture capital funds) are a glimpse of the future, as they crystallize the forefront of technology innovation everywhere in the world. They are the crystal ball to anticipate future industry trends.

Corporations have the industrial power - On the other side, we believe that corporations have the necessary resources to get things done and to put the best ideas at work on a global scale. In that sense, it is critical that they collaborate with startups, not only for themselves, not only for their survival but also for the greater good of humanity on this planet.

Bring the best of those two worlds together - We are technology optimists. We believe that tech innovation can contribute to solving major societal issues and world problems, provided that enough industrial power is injected into the process. We envision a world where innovation and industry powers connect seamlessly and globally, to speed up the world’s transformation.

Novable mission is to enable innovation through startup relations, by connecting the brightest minds from the startup ecosystem with the strong industrial ambitions of the business world. We allow corporations and companies to identify the most suitable, enterprise-ready innovations matching their strategic agenda.
Show more
HTML:
Join Novable, a pioneering force in corporate innovation. We connect startups with the industrial power of corporations to drive meaningful transformation.

Goal

Grow and maintain our cutting-edge database of innovative companies. Improve our Deep Matching technology to match the right startups with client needs.

Key Responsibilities

  • Work on R&D projects to improve smart crawlers through the use of LLM Agents
  • Develop efficient data processing pipelines
  • Develop evaluation processes for quality improvement
  • Improve our Deep Matching algorithm

Environment

  • Be part of a forward-thinking company with an inspiring mission to connect innovation with industrial power for global transformation.
  • Grow your skills by tackling challenging projects with real business impact.
  • Enjoy a fun work environment in Brussels, surrounded by passionate professionals committed to making an impact.

Profile

  • Strong Python skills
  • Familiar with MySQL and MongoDB
  • Passionate about generative AI and machine learning techniques
  • Familiar with Python API frameworks: Django, Flask, …
  • You love to solve problems, you can troubleshoot complex issues
  • Fun to work with, we take the sense of humour very seriously
  • Perfectly fluent in EN
  • Bonus: experience with AWS or other cloud provider

NOVABLE VISION: ENABLE INNOVATION THROUGH STARTUP RELATIONS

Novable is a tech startup active in the corporate innovation space, providing a startup scouting solution made of advanced technology software and dedicated analyst reviews. In particular, Novable develops an advanced AI-based technology to scout and match startups.

Startups have the innovation power - We believe that startup ecosystems (entrepreneurs, startups, scaleups, hubs, accelerators, venture capital funds) are a glimpse of the future, as they crystallize the forefront of technology innovation everywhere in the world. They are the crystal ball to anticipate future industry trends.

Corporations have the industrial power - On the other side, we believe that corporations have the necessary resources to get things done and to put the best ideas at work on a global scale. In that sense, it is critical that they collaborate with startups, not only for themselves, not only for their survival but also for the greater good of humanity on this planet.

Bring the best of those two worlds together - We are technology optimists. We believe that tech innovation can contribute to solving major societal issues and world problems, provided that enough industrial power is injected into the process. We envision a world where innovation and industry powers connect seamlessly and globally, to speed up the world’s transformation.

Novable mission is to enable innovation through startup relations, by connecting the brightest minds from the startup ecosystem with the strong industrial ambitions of the business world. We allow corporations and companies to identify the most suitable, enterprise-ready innovations matching their strategic agenda.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Kevin Edward Consultancy is a leading recruitment partner connecting top-tier talent with industry-leading clients. We are currently recruiting on behalf of one of our clients in Belgium.




Job Overview:

Our client is seeking an experienced Senior Data Engineer to join their Real-World Evidence (RWE) team. This role involves working on cutting-edge projects to pre-process and analyse healthcare data, support integration pipelines, and collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver impactful data solutions.

Key Responsibilities:

Pre-process and analyse RWE data using tools such as SQL, Python, and Azure Pipelines.
Manage data integration processes, including transferring data from providers via Azure or AWS, performing transformations, and loading data into databases.
Partner with biostatisticians and RWE experts to understand requirements and deliver tailored data solutions.
Develop and document efficient processes for data handling, transfer, and validation.
Create visualizations and build patient cohorts to support key research and analysis objectives.

Technical Requirements:

Proficiency in Python, SQL, and programming for data pipelines.
Hands-on experience with Microsoft Azure and cloud environments.
Familiarity with data models like the OMOP Common Data Model.
Experience with Microsoft Fabric is a plus (not mandatory).
Strong understanding of data integration and transformation in healthcare datasets.

Preferred Experience:

Background in real-world data (RWD) and US healthcare systems (e.g., insurers, hospitals, or payers).
Prior experience in the pharmaceutical or biopharma industry is highly desirable.
Knowledge of tools like SAS and expertise in data validation and documentation.

Soft Skills:

Strong communication and collaboration skills to effectively liaise with stakeholders, particularly in the US.
Exceptional documentation and process creation abilities.
Proactive, independent problem-solver with excellent organizational skills.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
B.E.S. (Business and Engineering Solutions) is looking for a Data Scientist to coordinate, define and execute the data activities in the automotive sector.







Your responsabilities :

You implement feature engineering techniques to extract main features from events, manoeuvres, and trips,
You support study of driver behaviour based on time series big data and aggregated demographics,
You support Link Driver Behaviour comprehensive groups with market and persona data,
You provide support in the application of data science methods in study cases,
You analyse customer survey data and market data,




Your profile :

You have a Master degree,
You are fluent in English (written and spoken), French is a real asset,
You have a first experience (internship, apprenticeship) in data,
You are interested in working in a sector at the heart of innovation,
You have knowldege in Python,
You have experience with big data,
You can work autonomously.




What can you except as a B.E.S. consultant?




Great projects in Engineering and High Technologies through major players to develop your technical skills and hard skills
Knowledge sharing processes though our competences centers and experts' communities to grow your multi-sectorial knowledge
A strong development plan to improve your soft skills such as Leadership, Communication skills, Change & People management capabilities…
A full package made of gross salary on 13.92 months, lunch allowance, entertainment expenses, company car & fuel card, group insurances OR a VIE!
A friendly, lively working environment within a dynamic and motivated team !!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
I am currently searching for a Machine Learning Engineer to join my client in Belgium on a payroll basis.




The ideal candidate will have knowledge of Python, Machine Learning and Java (Spring Boot).




**This position is also open to fully remote candidates based in the CET time-zone**




Your Role:

Architect and Develop ML Integration: Design and implement the software architecture for machine learning integration within the product.
Collaborate Across Teams: Work with stakeholders (product owners, data scientists, architects, front-end engineers) to align user requirements and standards with technical specifications and integration strategies.
Back-End Oversight: Lead the design and review of back-end systems, including data access layers, ensuring seamless functionality and scalability.
Continuous Improvement: Stay updated on emerging tech (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Azure ML) to refine back-end architecture and enhance ML integration capabilities.







Required Skills:

Educational Background: Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related field.
Technical Expertise:
Strong experience in software architecture and engineering.
Skilled in Python and Java (Spring Boot).
Deep understanding of data structures, algorithms, and OOP.
Proficient in machine learning concepts and tools.
Solid knowledge of relational databases (MySQL, PostgreSQL) and RESTful API design.
Work Environment: Agile/Scrum experience with a collaborative mindset.
Communication: Clear articulation of technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.




The Offer:

What We Offer:

Exciting Opportunities: Be part of a dynamic, fast-growing company in the industrial analytics space, working with a global team of experts in data science, software engineering, and industrial automation.
Competitive Benefits: Attractive salary, benefits package, and a company car or mobility budget.
Top-Tier Equipment: Developer laptop (MacBook Pro).
Flexibility: Work remotely up to 60% or fully remote if outside Belgium, with flexible working hours and a strong focus on work/life balance.
Prime Location: Access to a modern office at the Corda Campus in Hasselt.
Career Growth: Expand your skills and advance your career in a fast-expanding company with state-of-the-art tools and a visionary approach.
Supportive Environment: Collaborative, open-minded culture that encourages personal and professional development.
Learning Opportunities: Personal learning and development budget, company-managed, and external training opportunities.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
We are seeking a highly skilled Machine Learning Engineer with extensive experience in running and scaling models on public cloud platforms. The successful candidate will join our team to optimize, implement, and maintain our organization’s cloud-based systems.


Responsibilities:**
Design, develop, and deploy modular models on cloud-based systems.
Develop and maintain cloud solutions in accordance with best practices.
Ensure efficient functioning of data storage and processing functions, adhering to company security policies and best practices in cloud security.
Identify, analyze, and resolve infrastructure vulnerabilities and application deployment issues.
Regularly review existing models and systems, making recommendations for improvements.
Collaborate with engineering and development teams to evaluate and identify optimal cloud solutions.
Modify and improve existing systems.
Educate teams on the implementation of new cloud technologies and initiatives.
Technical Skills:**
Proven work experience as a Machine Learning Engineer or in a similar role.
Preferred: GCP certifications.
Strong troubleshooting and analytical skills.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Relevant training and/or certifications as a Google Cloud Engineer.
Proficiency in Google Compute Engine, including creating, managing, and scaling virtual machines (VMs) to meet diverse workload requirements.
Expertise in designing solution architecture on Google Cloud Platform (GCP), aligning with project-specific needs and objectives.
Strong grasp of programming languages such as Python, Java, Go, and Node.js.
Expertise in programming frameworks and libraries specific to GCP, such as Google Cloud SDK, Cloud Client Libraries, and Cloud APIs.
Understanding of serverless computing, containerization (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes), and event-driven architectures for developing scalable and efficient applications on GCP.
Knowledge of containers and infrastructure automation tools.
Proficiency in tools including Ansible, Docker, Windows PowerShell, and Linux/Unix.
Expertise in Google Cloud Storage.
Familiarity with other GCP services like BigQuery, Cloud Pub/Sub, and Cloud Functions.
Software Security Skills:**
Expertise in securing applications and data on Google Cloud, including:
Configuring Identity and Access Management (IAM) to control resource access.
Implementing network security measures such as firewall rules and encryption.
Monitoring and logging security events using tools like Stackdriver Logging.
Ensuring data encryption at rest and in transit.
Securing containers and Kubernetes clusters.
Complying with security standards and regulations.
Developing incident response plans.
Automating security checks and vulnerability scanning.
Following secure development practices.


These skills are crucial for maintaining the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of software systems deployed on Google Cloud and protecting against potential threats and vulnerabilities.


Coding and Scripting Skills**
Proficiency in programming languages like Python, Java, or Go to build and customize applications on the Google Cloud Platform.
Knowledge of infrastructure-as-code (IaC) tools such as Terraform and/or Google Cloud Deployment Manager enables defining and managing infrastructure resources using code. Automation is key, utilizing scripting languages and tools like Cloud SDK or Cloud APIs to automate tasks, deployments, and resource management.
Familiarity with containerization technologies like Docker and Kubernetes enables efficient deployment and management of applications. Cloud API integration and utilization of monitoring and logging tools like Stackdriver aid in application monitoring, troubleshooting, and enhancing overall performance. These skills empower developers to optimize and harness the capabilities of Google Cloud for building scalable and reliable cloud solutions.
Testing Skills**


The primary objective of any GCP Engineer is to expedite the software delivery process for clients, ensuring swift and efficient deployment.

To Excel GCP Skills, It Is Imperative To Possess


Strong testing skills and a comprehensive understanding of the testing process. Testing plays a critical role in driving automation and ensuring successful outcomes in the role.
Additionally, once the appropriate tests are established, a sense of assurance prevails, knowing that each component functions as intended. Tests can be conducted at various stages, from development to deployment, to ensure seamless integration of new features throughout the entire system.
Finally, emphasizing quality is paramount in the realm of applications and software. As a result, one should continuously prioritize and conduct rigorous testing to deliver high-quality work.


**Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment (CI/CD)**


Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) in Google Cloud refers to a set of practices and tools that enable developers to automate the process of building, testing, and deploying applications. CI involves automatically integrating code changes into a shared repository and running tests to ensure code quality. CD takes it further by automating the deployment of tested code to production environments. In Google Cloud, CI/CD pipelines can be set up using tools like Cloud Build, Cloud Source Repositories, and Cloud Deployment Manager. These pipelines help streamline development workflows, increase collaboration, and ensure rapid and reliable application delivery, allowing teams to deliver software updates more frequently and with reduced manual effort.
Azure DevOps and Azure Pipelines


An Ideal Candidate Should Also Demonstrate The Following Behaviours


Self-learning abilities
Radiates energy & enthusiasm for his field, and can instil the same passion in others
Naturally curious & always a step ahead
Critical thinker, challenging others in a constructive way, continuously looking for improvements
Can combine big-picture thinking, with zooming in on details.
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Bij Customaite transformeren we de douanemarkt met een robuust AI SaaS-product om douaneaangiften te versnellen. Ons product heeft het vertrouwen gewonnen van toonaangevende bedrijven in de logistieke sector, en we zijn klaar om dit verder op te schalen.

Vanuit Leuven werken we met een klein, dynamisch team en omarmen we een echte start-up mentaliteit, terwijl we profiteren van de middelen en expertise van ons moederbedrijf AE.




Als Machine Learning Engineer speel je een cruciale rol in de AI-systemen die ons product aandrijven om automatisch douaneaangiften voor te bereiden.




Wat is je focus?

Je werkt samen met je team aan nieuwe algoritmes en modellen voor gegevensextractie.
Je past onze bestaande algoritmes aan en optimaliseert ze voor meer efficiëntie en kwaliteit.
Je implementeert schaalbare Machine Learning modellen in onze productieomgeving.
Je verkent nieuwe technologieën om ons groeiende product vooruit te helpen.




Wie ben jij?

Je hebt een master diploma in Computerwetenschappen (of equivalent) met een specialisatie in AI.
Je hebt sterke software engineering skills.
Je hebt een product- en start-up mentaliteit, met een drive voor ondernemerschap en ownership.
Je hebt ervaring met Python en cloudtechnologie.
Je hebt ervaring met het implementeren van ML modellen in productieomgevingen.
Je hebt aantoonbare ervaring in Intelligent Document Processing projecten met behulp van NLP.
Je wil deel uitmaken van een productteam en bijdragen aan de toekomst van ons product.
Je beheerst het Nederlands goed, aangezien ons team in Leuven werkt en voornamelijk Nederlands spreekt.




Wat biedt Customaite jou?

Een uitdagende rol in een dynamische werkomgeving met veel ruimte voor initiatief.
Direct zichtbare impact op het product.
Een mensgerichte organisatie met een collegiale atmosfeer.
Een hybride werksysteem met veel flexibiliteit.




Zie jij jezelf in deze rol?




Reageer vandaag nog of solliciteer via deze pagina (AE - Machine Learning Engineer) en ontdek hoe jij een verschil kunt maken bij Customaite. Heb je vragen over de job, ons sollicitatieproces of onze unieke bedrijfscultuur? Neem contact op via onze Recruitment Lead voor Customaite: julie.vandenbossche@ae.be

 

Bij Customaite houden we van een persoonlijke aanpak en korte lijnen. Of je nu digitaal of fysiek langskomt, we kijken ernaar uit om je te ontmoeten!

Show more

Wat is je focus?

  • Je werkt samen met je team aan nieuwe algoritmes en modellen voor gegevensextractie.
  • Je past onze bestaande algoritmes aan en optimaliseert ze voor meer efficiëntie en kwaliteit.
  • Je implementeert schaalbare Machine Learning modellen in onze productieomgeving.
  • Je verkent nieuwe technologieën om ons groeiende product vooruit te helpen.


Wie ben jij?

  • Je hebt een master diploma in Computerwetenschappen (of equivalent) met een specialisatie in AI.
  • Je hebt sterke software engineering skills.
  • Je hebt een product- en start-up mentaliteit, met een drive voor ondernemerschap en ownership.
  • Je hebt ervaring met Python en cloudtechnologie.
  • Je hebt ervaring met het implementeren van ML modellen in productieomgevingen.
  • Je hebt aantoonbare ervaring in Intelligent Document Processing projecten met behulp van NLP.
  • Je wil deel uitmaken van een productteam en bijdragen aan de toekomst van ons product.
  • Je beheerst het Nederlands goed, aangezien ons team in Leuven werkt en voornamelijk Nederlands spreekt.


Wat biedt Customaite jou?

  • Een uitdagende rol in een dynamische werkomgeving met veel ruimte voor initiatief.
  • Direct zichtbare impact op het product.
  • Een mensgerichte organisatie met een collegiale atmosfeer.
  • Een hybride werksysteem met veel flexibiliteit.


Zie jij jezelf in deze rol?


Reageer vandaag nog of solliciteer via deze pagina (AE - Machine Learning Engineer) en ontdek hoe jij een verschil kunt maken bij Customaite. Heb je vragen over de job, ons sollicitatieproces of onze unieke bedrijfscultuur? Neem contact op via onze Recruitment Lead voor Customaite: julie.vandenbossche@ae.be

 

Bij Customaite houden we van een persoonlijke aanpak en korte lijnen. Of je nu digitaal of fysiek langskomt, we kijken ernaar uit om je te ontmoeten!

Title: Data Scientist - ML
Description:
RED Global is currently recruiting for a Data Scientist - ML for our client, a global organisation who are scaling up their data capability. They are looking to bring on board an experienced Data Scientist with experience of Machine Learning, GenAI and solution architecture and software engineering.







Key Responsibilities:

Responsible to support and advice various clients to identify and define problems and resolve these complex issues for the business.
You will interact with graph databases through standardized APIs and query languages and work with ETL Prosses.
Use AI techniques such as GenAI, supervised and un-supervised machine learning techniques.
Work across the latest data science platforms (Databricks, Dataiku, AzureML, SageMaker) and frameworks (e.g., Tensorflow, PyTorch, MXNet, scikit-learn).
Support with building and deploying solutions to Cloud (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) including Cloud provisioning tools (e.g., Terraform).
Advising to the business stakeholders on data driven marketing - working closely with third parties and, internally, with digital teams, IT, and others.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English and French/Dutch with good senior-level stakeholder management soft skills and competencies.




Required skills:

3-5 years experiences as a Data Scientist working within global organisations.
Extensive work experience of various Data Science Platforms such as Databricks, Dataiku, AzureML, SageMaker) and frameworks such as Tensorflow, PyTorch, MXNet, scikit-learn.
Experience building and deploying solutions to Cloud (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud).
Must have technical knowledge of Machine Learning (ML) or GenAI.
Industry skills: Manufacturing or Life sciences would be a plus.
Strong analytical skills and appreciation of coding languages, data sources, data matching and data acquisition.

Title: Data Scientist Senior - H/F (CDI)
Description:
Qui sommes-nous ?

Metrum est une société spécialisée dans l'accompagnement des entreprises dans leur transformation digitale, l'excellence opérationnelle et la gestion du changement. Forts de plus de 20 ans d'expérience, nous aidons nos clients à relever les défis technologiques de demain grâce à des expertises solides en développement, intégration de solutions, gestion de performance, transformation digitale et gouvernance des données. Chez Metrum, nous valorisons la collaboration, l'innovation et une culture d'entreprise conviviale où chaque talent peut s'épanouir.

Si vous êtes passionné par la technologie et motivé par l'excellence, rejoignez notre équipe pour un rôle clé dans l'accompagnement stratégique de nos clients !

Votre rôle

En tant que Data Scientist Senior, vous jouerez un rôle clé dans l'exploitation des données pour transformer les enjeux stratégiques de nos clients en solutions concrètes et innovantes. Vous interviendrez dans toutes les étapes du cycle de vie des projets Data Science, en apportant une expertise technique approfondie et une vision stratégique.

Vos principales missions incluront  :2. Analyse et exploration des données3. Développement de modèles avancés4. Collaboration pour l'industrialisation des solutions5. Veille technologique et innovation6. Encadrement et partage de connaissances


Compréhension et analyse des besoins métiers
Collaborer étroitement avec les équipes métiers et décisionnaires pour comprendre leurs défis et objectifs stratégiques
Traduire les problématiques métiers en cas d'usage concrets et en solutions analytiques exploitables
Identifier les opportunités de création de valeur grâce à l'exploitation des données (optimisation, automatisation, personnalisation, etc.)
Effectuer des analyses exploratoires approfondies pour identifier des tendances, anomalies ou patterns dans les données (data profiling)
Évaluer la qualité et la pertinence des données disponibles en vue de leur utilisation dans des modèles ou algorithmes
Mettre en œuvre des techniques avancées de visualisation pour communiquer efficacement les insights aux parties prenantes
Concevoir, implémenter et optimiser des modèles prédictifs et prescriptifs pour répondre aux problématiques métiers (régression, classification, clustering, optimisation, etc.)
Travailler sur des projets d'IA générative pour des cas d'usage tels que l'exploitation de capital intellectuel, automatisation intelligente,etc
Tester et valider la robustesse des modèles (ex : cross-validation, performance metrics) et ajuster les paramètres pour améliorer leur précision et fiabilité
Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les équipes de data engineers et data architects pour industrialiser les modèles développés
Participer à la mise en place de pipelines de données automatisés pour le déploiement et la maintenance des solutions de Data Science
Garantir l'intégration des modèles dans les systèmes existants, avec une attention particulière à la scalabilité et à la performance
Assurer une veille active sur les technologies émergentes, outils et frameworks en Data Science et IA
Explorer de nouvelles méthodes ou approches pour améliorer les performances des modèles ou répondre à des problématiques complexes
Participer à des conférences, meetups ou formations pour rester à la pointe des avancées dans le domaine
Encadrer et accompagner les data scientists plus juniors dans leur montée en compétences, tant sur les aspects techniques que méthodologiques
Encourager la collaboration et la création d'une dynamique d'apprentissage au sein de l'équipe



Requirements

Votre profil

Vous êtes doté(e) d'une solide expertise en Data Science et faites preuve d'un esprit analytique et d'un excellent sens relationnel. Voici les qualités et compétences recherchées :


Formation et expérience : Diplômé(e) Bac+5 en Management, Économie, Ingénieur, Mathématiques, Physique ou similaire avec au moins 5 ans d'expérience en tant que Data Scientist, idéalement dans différents secteurs, notamment l'industrie
Compétences techniques indispensables :
Maîtrise des concepts de probabilité et statistiques
Maîtrise de la modélisation en machine learning, optimisation, IA generative et traitement de séries de temps
Excellente maîtrise de Python et/ou R pour l'analyse de données
Expérience avec des frameworks de machine learning : scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch
Bonne connaissance des bases de données SQL et NoSQL
Compétences complémentaires qui représentent un plus :
Connaissance en manipulation de grandes masses de données et en programmation (Javascript, Spark, C)
Expérience avec des outils de visualisation de données (Power BI, Tableau, etc.) et des outils Cloud (AWS, GCP, Azure)
Capacités analytiques et organisationnelles : Aptitude à analyser des processus complexes et à vulgariser des résultats d'analyse
Polyvalence linguistique : Excellentes compétences en français et en anglais, tant à l'oral qu'à l'écrit. La maîtrise d'autres langues (allemand, luxembourgeois) est un plus
Soft skills : Autonomie, esprit d'équipe, bonne communication


Benefits

Pourquoi rejoindre Metrum ?


Une entreprise à taille humaine qui valorise le travail en équipe et le développement personnel
L'opportunité de contribuer à des projets stratégiques et innovants
Un cadre collaboratif, bienveillant et stimulant pour progresser dans votre carrière
Une culture qui prône l'équilibre entre vie professionnelle et vie personnelle


Envie de relever le défi ? Envoyez-nous votre candidature dès maintenant et intégrez une équipe passionnée où votre expertise sera pleinement reconnue !
Show more

Pourquoi rejoindre Metrum ?

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
At WeDoData we are working with a global leader in the Online gambling / iGaming sector who are looking to hire a Data Scientist to join their team.




Fully remote

60K EUR mid

80K EUR senior

10-15k annual bonus




What You Will Do

Design and develop advanced ML algorithms for image, text, audio, and tabular data
Develop and optimize pipelines in Azure to train models across various domains
Implement end-to-end applications in Python, including unit and integration tests
Continuously monitor system performance and troubleshoot issues
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to produce solutions to complex problems
Develop common packages and tools for logging, model inference, and more

Required Qualifications and Experience

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field
Strong proficiency in Python, PyTorch, and TensorFlow
Proven experience in managing and analyzing large datasets
Solid understanding of foundational DL algorithms
Expertise in unit and integration tests (Pytest) and CICD pipelines
Experience with data versioning, model management, experiment tracking, key evaluation metrics, and optimization techniques
Extensive knowledge and hands-on experience in Docker
Solid understanding of traditional Computer Vision and classical ML

Nice to Have

In-depth experience with computer vision models for object detection, image classification, and segmentation
Experience with Azure services (ML Studio, Data Factory, Functions, Blob Storage) or equivalent cloud provider services
Knowledge of AWS (Amazon Web Services) services, especially EC2 and S3
Experience with Huggingface Transformers, Elastic Stack, Gitlab CI pipelines
Experience with Prompt Engineering, Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG), LLM frameworks (LangChain, LlamaIndex, Haystack, ...), and fine-tuning LLMs

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
To reinforce our Benelux Data Office department, Allianz is currently looking for a Data Scientist. Are you looking for a role where you can be at the forefront of using cutting-edge data analytics techniques to drive strategic decisions and provide innovative solutions for business challenges? Join us at Allianz and be part of our dynamic team that leverages data science to drive innovation and make a meaningful impact in the insurance sector!




As a Data Scientist at Allianz, you will develop end-to-end, data-driven solutions to support decision-making systems at Allianz. You will engage with business functions to develop ideas, proof of concept to support a transformation business case and release your models to cloud-based state of the art production platform together with IT, senior engineers and scientists. You will analyze information from various data sources using statistics, including machine learning, to provide insights on various business problems. You will develop end-to-end, data-driven solutions (incl. GenAI) to support decision-making systems at Allianz.




What do you get in return?




We offer you a full-time challenging role in an international landscape based in Brussels or Rotterdam;
Working in a dynamic environment at Allianz, world leader in insurances;
You will work from our new office, from walkable distance from Brussel-North or Rotterdam Central station;
A pleasant working atmosphere within an experienced and enthusiastic team;
Development opportunities and a nice salary package supplemented with fringe benefits.




As Data Scientist, your main responsibilities will be:




Model Development and Integration: Build, implement, and continuously enhance machine learning and statistical models using cutting-edge tools. Focus on integrating these models into our IT infrastructure, ensuring scalability, reliability, and performance. Collaborate with IT and DevOps teams to deploy models in production environments, monitor their performance, and optimize for efficiency. Translate business problems into robust data-driven solutions while maintaining best practices in version control, testing, and documentation.
Collaborate with Stakeholders: Partner with business stakeholders to understand their challenges and convert them into actionable data science projects, ensuring that the solutions align with business objectives.
Data Management and Analysis: Acquire, clean, and integrate data from various sources to address business issues. Use advanced data analytics techniques to manipulate and interpret complex datasets, providing clear insights and answers to critical business questions.
Knowledge and Trend Analysis: Stay informed about the latest industry trends to maintain a competitive edge and apply this knowledge to drive strategic decisions and methodologies within the company.




Let’s do the match?




You have a Bachelors/Masters degree in a quantitative field such as Computer Science, Engineering, Econometrics, Physics, Actuarial, Statistics, or Mathematics? Check! Knowledge of machine learning principles and unsupervised machine learning techniques, including linear models and tree-based methods for regression and classification? Check! Ability to easily interpret common performance metrics? Check! Advanced skills in Python or R, proficiency in SQL and good knowledge of cloud data environments (e.g., Microsoft Azure)? Double check!




Have we peaked your interest? Join us and #LetsCareForTomorrow




Allianz is an equal opportunity employer and therefore welcomes applications regardless of ethnicity or cultural background, age, gender, nationality, religion, disability or sexual orientation.

Show more

Title: Data Scientist / AI Engineer
Description:
Job Description




My client are at the forefront of technology, specializing in AI-driven solutions within a rapidly evolving industry. Their mission is to push the boundaries of what's possible with AI, especially in sectors where precision and quality are paramount. We are looking for a visionary leader to join their team and drive cutting-edge projects that will shape the future.




They building a next-generation data platform, powered by Databricks on Azure, to support all our data initiatives. The goal is to transition toward a data mesh architecture that offers scalability, flexibility, and seamless access across teams. We believe that fostering collaboration and innovation creates a data-driven culture that empowers everyone to make informed decisions.




What You'll Do

Design and manage our data infrastructure on Databricks and Azure to ensure it is scalable and high-performing.
Work closely with data engineers, data scientists, and stakeholders to create a platform that aligns with various team needs.
Contribute to platform architecture using data mesh principles to enable decentralized data ownership.
Ensure the platform meets security and performance standards, and implement innovative best practices.
Collaborate with other teams to support end-to-end data integration and workflows for multiple data products.
Stay updated on the latest advancements in data platform technology and engineering.

Your Background

3-5 years of experience in data engineering, ideally within a data and analytics setting.
A Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or a similar field.
Strong expertise in Azure and Databricks, including infrastructure as code, data lake storage, and ETL processes.
Excellent problem-solving abilities and a passion for innovation.
Familiarity with data mesh concepts and experience working within decentralized data architectures.
Strong communication and collaboration skills, with a drive to work with cross-functional teams.

What We Offer

We’re committed to creating a supportive, inclusive environment that values personal growth and work-life balance. Here’s what we offer:

An international, diverse workspace with professionals from various fields.
A culture that emphasizes respect, collaboration, and continuous learning.
An extensive onboarding program, with mentorship to help you grow.
Competitive salary, comprehensive health coverage, paid leave, retirement benefits, and flexible work arrangements.
