HTML:
Job Description


My client are at the forefront of technology, specializing in AI-driven solutions within a rapidly evolving industry. Their mission is to push the boundaries of what's possible with AI, especially in sectors where precision and quality are paramount. We are looking for a visionary leader to join their team and drive cutting-edge projects that will shape the future.


They building a next-generation data platform, powered by Databricks on Azure, to support all our data initiatives. The goal is to transition toward a data mesh architecture that offers scalability, flexibility, and seamless access across teams. We believe that fostering collaboration and innovation creates a data-driven culture that empowers everyone to make informed decisions.


What You'll Do

  • Design and manage our data infrastructure on Databricks and Azure to ensure it is scalable and high-performing.
  • Work closely with data engineers, data scientists, and stakeholders to create a platform that aligns with various team needs.
  • Contribute to platform architecture using data mesh principles to enable decentralized data ownership.
  • Ensure the platform meets security and performance standards, and implement innovative best practices.
  • Collaborate with other teams to support end-to-end data integration and workflows for multiple data products.
  • Stay updated on the latest advancements in data platform technology and engineering.

Your Background

  • 3-5 years of experience in data engineering, ideally within a data and analytics setting.
  • A Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or a similar field.
  • Strong expertise in Azure and Databricks, including infrastructure as code, data lake storage, and ETL processes.
  • Excellent problem-solving abilities and a passion for innovation.
  • Familiarity with data mesh concepts and experience working within decentralized data architectures.
  • Strong communication and collaboration skills, with a drive to work with cross-functional teams.

What We Offer

We’re committed to creating a supportive, inclusive environment that values personal growth and work-life balance. Here’s what we offer:

  • An international, diverse workspace with professionals from various fields.
  • A culture that emphasizes respect, collaboration, and continuous learning.
  • An extensive onboarding program, with mentorship to help you grow.
  • Competitive salary, comprehensive health coverage, paid leave, retirement benefits, and flexible work arrangements.

Title: ML Engineer - Gen AI
Description:
Are you a passionate Machine Learning Engineer with expertise in generative AI?




In this role, you will collaborate closely with data scientists and engineers from our Cloud and DevSecOps teams to implement best practices and ensure technical excellence across multiple projects. Utilizing open-source frameworks like LangChain and Azure-based tools, including the Azure AI Services suite, you will maintain and expand our repository of AI assets. Your innovative mindset will help identify and develop state-of-the-art solutions that deliver business value, while your commitment to staying current with AI advancements will ensure our team remains at the forefront of technology.




As a member of the Machine Learning Enablers team, you will actively research and develop agent-based AI use cases, focusing on multi-agent systems. Your work will support the day-to-day needs of our data scientists through the practical maintenance and enhancement of AI assets, while also driving innovation in our AI initiatives.




Responsibilities:




Develop and Maintain our Generative AI Repository.

Manage and expand our repository of reusable Generative AI components on Azure DevOps, ensuring it’s robust, up-to-date, and user-friendly, and implements MLOps standadrs.
Collaborate with data scientists to identify new components to build, provide technical support, and promote best practices in using the repository.

Develop and Implement Agent-Based AI Solutions.

Research and experiment with multi-agent systems and emerging frameworks to address real-world use cases in Proximus’ context.
Develop proof-of-concept projects to validate innovative multi-agent AI applications.
Design and create reusable components that enable data scientists to integrate agent-based approaches into their projects.

Collaborate and Drive Technical Excellence.

Implement and promote machine learning best practices (e.g., MLFlow), ensuring high-quality standards across the team.
Stay current with the latest trends, models, and frameworks, and communicate them to the team.




Your Profile:

Master’s degree in Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related quantitative field.
A Ph.D. is a plus, especially with research in Generative AI or agent-based systems.
Minimum of 2 years of relevant work experience in a business environment.
Proven experience working with generative AI models and LLMs in real-world projects.
Demonstrated ability to develop proof-of-concept projects, and transition innovative solutions to production-ready components.
Strong collaboration and communication skills, with experience working alongside a diverse team of technical and non-technical stakeholders.




Technical Skills:

Strong coding skills in Python, with proficiency in software development best practices, including version control (e.g., Git) and DevOps (e.g., CI/CD pipelines).
Hands-on experience implementing MLOps best practices (e.g., experiment tracking with MLFlow).
Experience with Microsoft Azure and Azure AI Services.
Experience with LangChain and other Generative AI frameworks.
Ability to drive innovation by experimenting with new techniques and frameworks to solve real-world problems.
Familiarity with Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) architectures and improvement techniques.
Strong communication skills for providing technical support, mentorship, and clear guidance to team members.
Strong collaboration skills and ability to manage tasks independently.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with keen attention to detail.
Experience contributing to the development of reusable AI components or libraries, contributions to open-source AI projects is an asset.
Experience with multi-agent systems and related frameworks (e.g. LangGraph, CrewAI, AutoGen).
Familiarity with monitoring and evaluation tools for generative AI applications.
Fluent in English and preferably also French and/or Dutch.
Show more

Title: AI/ML Software Engineer
Description:
Are you looking for a new opportunity to take your career to a higher orbit? To join an international group with a successful track record in Space Engineering? A job adapted to your career ambitions and in which you could have an impact for the years to come.




We’re seeking a talented AI/ML Software Engineer to work at our office in Diegem, near Brussels, Belgium.




Your initial mission will be to develop, implement, and maintain advanced machine learning models and algorithms to drive data analysis and predictive capabilities for the in-orbit early demonstration of the European RF Spectrum Monitoring System.




Tasks and activities

The scope of work will include:

Develop, implement, and maintain advanced machine learning models and algorithms to drive data analysis and predictive capabilities within the organization.
Work closely with data scientists to integrate machine learning models into data pipelines. Enhance data quality and structure to facilitate effective model training and validation.
Utilize embedded software knowledge to optimize data collection and transmission in IoT devices and other hardware interfaces.
Apply knowledge of SDR technologies to process and analyze radio frequency signals within the data engineering framework.
Support space mission operations by developing and implementing data engineering solutions tailored to space-related data processing needs.




Skills and experience

The following skills and experience are mandatory:

University Degree or equivalent in Computer science or a relevant field.
Strong understanding of machine learning principles, algorithms, and frameworks.
Proven experience in data science, including statistical analysis, data modelling, and machine learning.
Knowledge of embedded software development and hardware-software integration.
Familiarity with SDR technologies and their application in signal processing.
Previous experience in space operations, preferably in data engineering or related fields.
Experience with writing requirements, design documentation, and test documentation.
Desire to work both autonomously and as part of a team, in an international multicultural environment.
Solution oriented mindset, with a customer focused communication skill.
Fluent in English, both written and spoken.




The following skills and experience would be highly desirable:

Proficient in programming languages such as Python, Java, Scala, and SQL.
Deep understanding of databases, both relational and NoSQL, including design, implementation, and optimization.
Experience with big data technologies like Hadoop, Spark, and Hive.
Familiarity with ETL tools such as Apache Nifi, Talend, and Apache Airflow.
Strong understanding of distributed systems and fault tolerance.
Knowledge of data warehousing solutions and data architecture.
Ability to develop and maintain data pipelines for real-time and batch processing.
Excellent problem-solving abilities and attention to detail.
Strong collaboration and communication skills.
Knowledge of space system engineering and design methodologies.
Knowledge of industry standards ECSS.




Why should you apply?

You will have the opportunity to work within leading space organisations across Europe.
We encourage everyone to think outside the box and to push the boundaries of traditional knowledge. This role is an opportunity to join a forward-thinking company and allows for a deeper understanding of the industry.
To be part of a company that values integrity, inspiration, care and collaboration.
Benefits include: competitive remuneration packages; unique career opportunities, including working in other countries; access to training and development programmes; flexible relocation support.
We welcome applications from people with disabilities, members of ethnic minorities, all genders, LGBTQ+ individuals and ex-service personnel.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Are you ready to learn fast and have a real impact in your job?




Join Odoo, a growing software company with an open source product,

a huge global community, as well as a fun and exciting work environment.




We are now looking for a Data Scientist to join our FP&A team. This person will play a strategic role in making the most of transactional data. Our Data Scientist will improve efficiency, anticipate risks, and make informed decisions to optimize commercial and financial operations.




We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Data Scientist to join our Finance department. As a Data Scientist, you will play a central role in analysing large datasets, identifying patterns, and developing predictive models to enhance our FP&A department.

You will analyse transaction data, such as purchases, payments or transfers, to detect trends and patterns. Another key role is to optimise transaction processes to improve efficiency. For example, by analysing processing times, bottlenecks or transaction failure rates, you will suggest adjustments to smooth operations and reduce costs.

You'll build cash flow or revenue forecasting models based on historical transaction trends. These forecasts will help Odoo to better manage their budget and anticipate their cash flow needs. You'll monitor transaction performance, in terms of success rate, turnaround time, and customer satisfaction. Thanks to these analyses, Odoo will be able to adjust its strategies to improve the overall performance of its transactional services.

Your work will directly impact our ability to deliver secure, efficient, and optimized analysis within our company.




Programming Languages: Python
Database: SQL
Machine learning models: regression, classification, clustering
Framework: Odoo (ORM, Workflows, Report Engine, BI, AI)







Responsibilities:

Create complex and custom data models in Odoo, often working with financial, accounting, and other enterprise data. Compile, normalize, and analyse disparate datasets to help solve problems.
Help improve efficiency in processing large quantities of data by automating repeatable processes
Perform advanced querying techniques in SQL (and other database languages) to profile, summarize, make sense of, and trace information across systems
Assist with drafting reports, presentations, and other deliverables to create dashboards in Odoo to present analytics-driven insights to internal teams
Communicate effectively to all levels of engagement management and externally







Must Have

Master Degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field
1+ year of experience in data science, with a focus on the transaction services
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or SQL
Good Communication
Attention to Detail
Team Player: Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and contribute to the success of cross-functional projects
Excellent command of English







Nice to have

Experience in the financial services or transaction services industry
Demonstrated experience in programming or contributing to large codebases
Knowledge of statistical methods, data mining, and predictive analytics
Familiarity with regulatory requirements and compliance standards in the transaction services industry
Knowledge of transaction processing systems, or financial services is highly desirable

Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
(Would Require Relocation) EU Citizens Only




Senior Machine Learning Engineer – Malmö (Onsite, 5 Days a Week)




Seeking a Senior Machine Learning Engineer for a long-term contract (6-12 months to start) with a high-impact project in Malmö. You'll work closely with engineers, researchers, and designers to develop and deploy advanced ML models.




Key Responsibilities:

Design and build scalable ML systems for real-world applications.
Develop and deploy cutting-edge models for complex problems.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to translate user needs into technical solutions.

Requirements:

Strong experience in developing, deploying, and optimising ML models in production.
Proficiency in Python and frameworks like PyTorch.
Hands-on experience with large-scale datasets and distributed systems.
Excellent problem-solving and communication skills.

Nice-to-Have:

Experience with Transformer models and real-time inference.
Background in dataset curation and annotation.
Knowledge of GIS data and/or Scala.
Advanced degree (MSc/PhD) in ML, AI, or related fields.
Contributions to open-source ML projects or published research.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Department: Data

Employment Type: Full Time

Location: Remote

Description

We’re seeking a highly skilled Data Scientist to join our analytics team, driving performance optimization and providing strategic insights. You will be responsible for developing and refining LTV, ROAS prediction models, and working with SKAdNetwork (SKAN) data to enhance user acquisition and marketing efficiency. This is a hands-on role where you’ll also lead the development of foundational marketing analytics systems.

All The Responsibilities We'll Trust You With


You'll be working on hands-on development and refinement of LTV and ROAS predictive models to optimize marketing spend.
You'll maintain and improve SKAN ETL pipelines, ensuring accurate collection and analysis of post-install metrics to inform marketing strategy .
You'll analyze marketing KPIs like CAC, CTR, ROAS, and conversion rates, delivering actionable insights to drive campaign performance.
You'll collaborate cross-functionally with marketing, product, and data engineering teams to identify data needs and strategies .
You'll design and implement A/B tests for user acquisition campaigns, measuring impact and optimizing channels.
You'll create dashboards and reports to visualize marketing performance and trends, communicating insights to non-technical stakeholders .
You'll proactively drive the evolution of marketing analytics by identifying data-driven opportunities and building foundational analytics processes.


What You'll Bring To The Team


2-3+ years of experience in marketing data science or analytics (preferably in mobile gaming or apps).
Proficiency in SQL, Python (or R), with a strong background in building and deploying LTV/ROAS prediction models.
Experience working with SKAN and marketing attribution tools .
Strong understanding of key marketing metrics such as CAC, ROAS, LTV, and engagement metrics.
Experience in machine learning techniques (e.g., regression, classification) for building predictive models.
Experience in A/B testing and statistical analysis.
Proven ability to work independently and drive projects autonomously in a fast-paced environment .
Familiarity with BI tools such as Metabase, Looker, or Tableau.


Why You'll Love Working With Us


We’re 100% remote, work wherever you want forever!
We offer unlimited holidays and sick days. Take as much time off as you need, to spend time with your family and friends or just because you feel like playing games all day. We trust our team and want to offer a modern work life balance that allows you to thrive both at work and in your personal life.
You’ll be able to make an impact, to work closely with the rest of the team and its leads to work on one of the most promising upcoming games in the mobile gaming industry and the Web3 space.
You’ll have a comfortable work schedule and stable workload. With a variety of tasks that will allow your constant professional development.
We want our team to grow personally and professionally and support learning opportunities, especially with a focus around new AI tools and methods.
We have a culture that puts our people first. We believe in open communication, creativity and the value of unique contributions from everyone in the team.
We offer a competitive salary in addition to equity option plans.

Title: AI Deep Learning Engineer
Description:
AI Deep Learning Engineer




👉 About Scalian




Join our team of industry leaders at Scalian, where for over 30 years, innovation and expertise come together. As a leading multinational engineering consultancy firm, we have over 6000 highly skilled specialists. Our focus on Digital Systems and Operational Performance, including IT, software and systems engineering, quality assurance, supply chain management, and project management, sets us apart in the industry.

Our expertise serves various technology sectors such as automotive, aerospace, medical, defense, rail, and energy while providing distinctive support for their development and operations.




👉 Project Description




We are currently looking for an experienced AI Deep Learning Engineer for one of our clients specializing in the semiconductor sector. In this role, you will play a critical part in advancing semiconductor imaging processes by leveraging cutting-edge AI and deep learning models. You will collaborate with global teams and cross-functional experts to develop innovative AI-driven solutions for image analysis and enhancement.




Your tasks will involve:




Designing and implementing AI sub-system components.
Leading and mentoring junior engineers in AI development.
Evaluating and applying state-of-the-art Deep Learning (DL), Generative AI (GenAI), and Computer Vision (CV) algorithms for image processing.
Implementing and optimizing DL/GenAI/CV models for data preprocessing, analysis, and postprocessing phases using C++ and Python.
Performing model evaluation, fine-tuning, A/B testing, and performance validation.
Presenting technical concepts and results to peers and customers to drive project success.




👉 Your strengths




Background: PhD or Master's degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or related field.
3+ years of experience in applying AI and deep learning to industrial applications, particularly image processing.
Strong programming skills in Python and C++, with proficiency in frameworks like PyTorch, TensorFlow, or JAX.
Expertise in DL, reinforcement learning, LLMs, vision foundation models, or multi-modal modeling.
Excellent analytical and communication skills.
Ability to collaborate with cross-functional and multicultural teams.
Self-driven, proactive, and results-oriented.




👉 What Scalian can offer you




We offer a competitive salary package and attractive extra-legal conditions, including:

An interesting bonus system.
A company car.
Hospitalization insurance.
Meal vouchers and eco-vouchers.




At Scalian, you will find a people-oriented environment where values such as community, teamwork, and career management are key.




Position to be filled on a permanent basis, based around Leuven.




Do you recognize yourself in this project summary? Do not hesitate to contact us and send us your CV!

Show more
HTML:
AI Deep Learning Engineer


👉 About Scalian


Join our team of industry leaders at Scalian, where for over 30 years, innovation and expertise come together. As a leading multinational engineering consultancy firm, we have over 6000 highly skilled specialists. Our focus on Digital Systems and Operational Performance, including IT, software and systems engineering, quality assurance, supply chain management, and project management, sets us apart in the industry.

Our expertise serves various technology sectors such as automotive, aerospace, medical, defense, rail, and energy while providing distinctive support for their development and operations.


👉 Project Description


We are currently looking for an experienced AI Deep Learning Engineer for one of our clients specializing in the semiconductor sector. In this role, you will play a critical part in advancing semiconductor imaging processes by leveraging cutting-edge AI and deep learning models. You will collaborate with global teams and cross-functional experts to develop innovative AI-driven solutions for image analysis and enhancement.


Your tasks will involve:


  • Designing and implementing AI sub-system components.
  • Leading and mentoring junior engineers in AI development.
  • Evaluating and applying state-of-the-art Deep Learning (DL), Generative AI (GenAI), and Computer Vision (CV) algorithms for image processing.
  • Implementing and optimizing DL/GenAI/CV models for data preprocessing, analysis, and postprocessing phases using C++ and Python.
  • Performing model evaluation, fine-tuning, A/B testing, and performance validation.
  • Presenting technical concepts and results to peers and customers to drive project success.


👉 Your strengths


  • Background: PhD or Master's degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or related field.
  • 3+ years of experience in applying AI and deep learning to industrial applications, particularly image processing.
  • Strong programming skills in Python and C++, with proficiency in frameworks like PyTorch, TensorFlow, or JAX.
  • Expertise in DL, reinforcement learning, LLMs, vision foundation models, or multi-modal modeling.
  • Excellent analytical and communication skills.
  • Ability to collaborate with cross-functional and multicultural teams.
  • Self-driven, proactive, and results-oriented.


👉 What Scalian can offer you


We offer a competitive salary package and attractive extra-legal conditions, including:

  • An interesting bonus system.
  • A company car.
  • Hospitalization insurance.
  • Meal vouchers and eco-vouchers.


At Scalian, you will find a people-oriented environment where values such as community, teamwork, and career management are key.


Position to be filled on a permanent basis, based around Leuven.


Do you recognize yourself in this project summary? Do not hesitate to contact us and send us your CV!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
AI/ML Engineer - LLM Optimization Startup - £120k +equity – Remote (UK/EU)




Are you an AI/ML Engineer with experience in optimizing LLMs?




Do you have experience in improving AI systems’ performance? If so, we have the perfect opportunity for you.




The challenge

The rise of AI has skyrocketed demand for computational power. However, current solutions are expensive and dominated by large corporations. We're tackling this challenge by leading the development of technology to drive the efficiency and performance of AI models. We’ve built a decentralized marketplace for compute power specifically designed for large language models (LLMs) with billions of parameters.




We started less than a year ago, spinning out of an incubator and have grown to 12 people so far. We’re looking for an AI/ML Engineer to join us in optimizing our platform, identifying bottlenecks and improving the performance of our system.




About you

You’ll have experience evaluating research to identify and implement innovative solutions. Ideally, you’ll have a background in distributed AI/ML, inferencing, or optimisation/quantisation. Prototyping skills are also important, though production-grade expertise isn’t required—our team has specialists to handle that for you.




You’ll have experience with large language models, fine-tuning and training them along with a strong theoretical understanding of how to optimise them. You’ll be familiar with things like parallel training methods and understand how to reduce active parameters, minimise the impact of network bandwidth, define memory footprint impact on compute latency.




What we are looking for is someone with:

A solid background in Foundational NLP
At least 3 years’ experience of hands on developing, training and deploying NLP models
Experience with High Performance Computing (NVIDIA)
Experience with Parallel and/or Distributed computing
Experience implementing solutions from research
Experience fine tuning some of the more recent LLMs (OpenAI, Anthropic, Claude, LLaMA etc)




Academic/Research background in following fields would be big bonus:

Distributed ML
Inferencing
Optimization
Quantization




You’ll be an early member of the team that have secured $2.5 million dollars pre-seed, and will receive equity in the business. You’ll be working remotely, with others in the team being spread across, UK, US (East Coast), Dubai and Europe.




Please note: you must be eligible to work in the UK or EU to be considered for this position.




Interested?

If you think you fit the bill, get in touch by clicking the ‘apply now’ button or get in touch with me by the following:

Email me at mo@mbnsolutions.com
Call me on 02037736498

Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Requisition ID: 2980

Location:

Louvain-la-Neuve, BE

Work regime: Full-Time

Kind of contract: Open Ended Contract

Mission

The Belgian, B-Corp certified company IBA has opened new ways to diagnose and fight cancer and is the global leader in the field of Proton Therapy, next to its activities in radiopharmaceuticals, industrial sterilization and dosimetry.

Challenges we trust you with

The Data team at IBA focuses on using data to add value to the lives of our customers and colleagues. We value agility, ownership, and we are not afraid to challenge the status quo.

Your mission is to help our business teams with extracting insights from data through statistics and artificial intelligence. You'll use your experience to work closely with our data engineers, data scientists and business domain experts to ensure that your projects deliver tangible value and help build IBA a competitive advantage through data. More concretely, you will contribute to applications for predictive maintenance, as well as demonstrate feasibility in ambitious R&D projects.

We are looking for an experienced data professional who can drive a data project end-to-end. This includes deep diving in the business domain, exploring available data, suggesting improvements for data collection, as well as building, deploying, and monitoring AI models and visualizing the results.

How will your first months look like?

First, you’ll get onboarded on our data infrastructure and get a better understanding of the tools we are using. Next, you’ll be introduced on your first data science challenges.

Must-have

What we value


At least 3 years of relevant experience
Solid foundation in all steps of CRISP-DM
Strong foundation in statistics and AI, through education or experience
Proven experience in delivering AI projects
Motivation to understand our business and integrate our domain knowledge
Strong communicator that can describe complex topics in a simple way
Fluent in English, French is a plus
Passionate about data


Nice To Have


Experience with time series and/or natural language projects
Experience with Databricks and Spark
Experience with predictive maintenance
Experience working in an R&D environment


Cherry on the cake

IBA Offers


Competitive salary and benefits, including a company car
Flexible home office policy (3days/week)
Career growth within a globally recognized leader in medical technology
A supportive team environment that values each member's development
A commitment to cutting-edge technology and solving challenging problems
Be part of a BCorp Certified company, balancing professional innovation with personal well-being


Join us at IBA, where you can be part of a dynamic team working on cutting-edge technology in the fight against cancer. Let's make a difference together!
Show more

Title: Junior Developer (Python)
Description:
Squareflow is a growing company founded in 2020 by entrepreneurs (just like you). We embrace technology to create business value with Odoo as an enabler. We believe that any business can be digital first.




To strengthen our team, we are looking for junior developer. As a developer, you'll be in regular contact with clients and our teams in order to deliver solutions based on understanding of their specific needs in terms of business business/IT alignment.




Function:




As a junior developer, your specific tasks and responsibilities may include:




Develop solutions for our clients from many different industries, sectors and company size
Support and maintain those specific solutions
Implement the client's needs in the Odoo solution before configuring it
Create training material and documentation for Odoo users
Deliver informative, well-organized demos to business teams
Accompany and train end-users to the new tool (train the trainer approach) on Odoo and related applications
Develop and maintain processes to continuously monitor data quality
Coordinate test execution to ensure that all technical customizations and configurations follow industry and delivery best practices
Contribute to the daily development of Squareflow




Your profile :




Bachelor or Master degree (preferably in business, engineering or computer science)
Several programming languages ( Python & JavaScript)
Excellent communication (written and oral) in French and English and interpersonal skills
Structural thinking
Ability to learn and evolve quickly
Ability to work autonomously but also in team with a “Can Do attitude”
Creatively and pragmatic in a problem-solving environment
Fast-learner with a specific interest in Digital




WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?




More that a technical knowledge combined with our business positioning, we live our values on a daily basis : teamwork, transparency, commitment.




We offer:

A competitive salary package, with car and other benefits
Exciting projects with a strong use of Odoo
The opportunity to grow your superpower in a challenging context
The possibility to follow regular trainings
The opportunity to think, build and adopt beyond solutions




Squareflow is an equal opportunity employer. We will not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, age, national origin, disability or sexual orientation, in any of its activities or operations.

Title: Data Scientist H/F
Description:
A propos de JEMS

Nous sommes le seul industriel de la donnée en Europe. Notre métier est de créer, manager et exploiter le patrimoine data de nos clients.

Nous avons la conviction que chaque entreprise peut adopter une démarche innovante de gestion de la donnée et créer des cas d’usage disruptifs en réduisant l'impact écologique et en diminuant la dette technique.

Nous comptons plus de 840 collaborateurs en mission chez nos clients grands comptes dans tout secteur d’activité : banque, assurance, santé, énergie, e-commerce, automobile, luxe, retail, transport, agritech…

Vos missions

Vous Aurez La Charge De

Nous recherchons un(e) Data Scientist capable de trouver des solutions innovantes et robustes à l'ensemble des problématiques Data. Gourou de la donnée, vous vous amusez à faire parler les données et à les mettre au service des entreprises. Vous êtes donc à la croisée d'enjeux fonctionnels et stratégiques :


Étudier des données en possession de l’entreprise
Définir et récupérer des données pertinentes à extraire et à traiter en lien avec la production de l’entreprise, la vente ou encore liées aux données clients
Développer des algorithmes permettant d’améliorer les résultats de recherches et de ciblages
Élaborer des modèles prédictifs afin d’anticiper l’évolution des données et tendances relatives à l’activité de l’entreprise


Vos compétences

En tant que Data Scientist H/F vous maîtrisez :


L'architecture des bases de données décisionnelles (data warehouse)
Les mathématiques appliquées : construire des algorithmes pour améliorer les résultats de recherches et de ciblages
Les statistiques


Et Vous Disposez


De solides compétences en programmation informatique (Python, R…)
D'une expertise en algorithmie et gestion des bases de données (NoSQL, Cassandra…)
De la connaissance des méthodologies agiles


Votre profil

Diplômé(e) d'une école d'ingénieur ou d'une université, vous justifiez d'au minimum 3 ans d'expérience professionnelle dans un contexte projet Data. Rigoureux(se), proactif(ve) et autonome vous restez en veille technologique et êtes force de proposition. Vous êtes capable de prendre de la hauteur et vous adapter aux enjeux du projet.

Avantages à travailler chez JEMS


Une JEMS Académie au service de votre montée en compétences (formations et certifications sur les technologies de pointe)
Un accompagnement personnalisé et un management de proximité pour vous proposer des évolutions de carrière
Une intégration dans des communautés techniques et de pratiques JEMS (encadrement par des experts, échanges sur les bonnes pratiques, favoriser l'innovation...)
Une entreprise reconnue "Great Place To Work"
Des évènements et séminaires inoubliables, des soirées d'agence conviviales


Mobilité

Une mobilité nationale et internationale pour vous accompagner dans vos projets de vie.

Diversité

Le Groupe JEMS porte fièrement sa valeur "Diversité" en se mobilisant pour l'inclusion et l'égalité des chances et en luttant contre toutes formes de discrimination.

Tous nos postes sont ouverts aux personnes en situation de handicap.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About Company:

Our client is at the forefront of transforming how creators and advertisers connect. By combining AI-driven insights with the dynamic possibilities of the creator economy, they’re building a platform that empowers creators and gives advertisers unmatched transparency and ROI.




With groundbreaking features like Squad key trading and AI-based engagement matching, the company is redefining what’s possible in Web3. Their mission is clear: to unlock the full potential of creators while setting new standards for innovation in the industry.




Job Summary:

As a Data Scientist at the company, you will play a pivotal role in designing and implementing the systems that determine creator pricing. Your work will directly influence the success of their creators, the satisfaction of advertisers, and the growth of the company as the go-to platform in Web3.




You’ll join a fast-paced, innovative environment where your ideas will be heard, your expertise valued, and your impact felt.




Key Responsibilities:

Develop Data Models: Design and implement data-driven frameworks to dynamically price creators based on engagement metrics, Squad key prices, market trends, and other key variables.
Leverage Machine Learning: Build predictive models to forecast creator performance, audience engagement, and campaign outcomes.
Analyze Large Datasets: Process and analyze social media metrics, creator activity, and transactional data to identify trends and opportunities for optimization.
Collaborate with Engineering Teams: Work closely with backend developers to ensure seamless integration of pricing algorithms into the platform.
Monitor and Optimize: Continuously evaluate the effectiveness of pricing models, testing and refining based on platform and market data.
Create Visualizations and Reports: Generate dashboards and reports to communicate insights and recommendations to stakeholders.
Innovate Data Pipelines: Design and implement scalable data pipelines for real-time analytics and decision-making.
Stay Ahead of Trends: Research advancements in AI, data science, and the creator economy to keep Hub’s platform innovative and competitive.




What You Bring




Technical Skills:

Advanced experience in data science, machine learning, or econometrics, with a strong focus on marketplace or dynamic pricing models.
Deep understanding of social media engagement metrics and their role in the creator economy.
Proficiency in tools such as Python, R, TensorFlow, or similar.
Familiarity with blockchain technology, tokenomics, and Web3 ecosystems (preferred).
Strong skills in data visualization and conveying insights to cross-functional teams.




Soft Skills:

Exceptional problem-solving skills with the ability to tackle ambiguous, complex challenges.
Strong communication skills and a proven ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams.
A passion for innovation, creativity, and empowering the creator economy.




Why Join Us?

Make an Impact: Your work will define how creators are valued and shape the future of the creator economy.
Grow with Us: Be part of a fast-growing company at the cutting edge of AI, Web3, and creator-driven innovation.
Collaborate with Talent: Work alongside a passionate, high-performing team dedicated to tackling big challenges.
Enjoy Flexibility: Remote work with a dynamic and empowering culture.
Competitive Benefits: Attractive salary, performance-based incentives, and token bonuses tied to platform growth.




Benefits:

Competitive salary and token bonuses.
Fully remote with flexible working hours.
Opportunities to shape the direction of a fast-growing platform.
Professional development opportunities in AI, Web3, and creator economy expertise.
An inclusive, empowering company culture where your contributions matter.
Show more

Title: Applied ML Engineer
Description:
Join an AI-powered platform transforming how creators, filmmakers, and animators craft videos with precise control.




Position: Applied ML Engineer

Location: Remote

Salary: upto €130,000




Key Responsibilities:

Develop and maintain ML pipelines aligned with our product roadmap.
Deploy and optimize GenAI models like Stable Diffusion and GANs.
Collaborate with design and engineering teams to solve unique challenges.
Build scalable, cost-effective APIs for cloud-based models.




Requirements:

Title: AI Scientist
Description:
Purpose

The AI Scientist at Keytrade Bank is a critical role in leveraging the potential of artificial intelligence to drive innovation, efficiency, and compliance within the bank. This individual will design, develop, and maintain AI systems while addressing governance, compliance, and ethical considerations. They will also enhance existing AI products and integrate advanced cloud-based technologies, ensuring Keytrade Bank remains a leader in the responsible and effective use of AI within the financial sector.




Reporting Line

The AI Scientist will report to the AI Innovation Lead and collaborate closely with the data feature team.




Responsibilities

Design, implement and test AI models to enhance decision-making, customer experiences, and operational efficiencies.
Maintain, optimize and test existing AI solutions, ensuring they adapt to emerging technologies and evolving business needs.
Collaborate with teams to integrate AI systems with UI technologies, such as Mendix, to enhance usability and functionality.
Implement and enhance MLOps/DevOps best practices for streamlined development, deployment, and monitoring of AI solutions.
Ensure responsible and ethical use of AI at Keytrade Bank, following guidelines of EU regulations (EU AI Act, GDPR …)
Help in establishing policies to govern the lifecycle of AI models, including accountability, fairness, and transparency.
Work with cross-functional teams to embed governance practices into the deployment of AI systems.
Collaborate with internal security and risk teams to assess and mitigate AI-related risks.
Stay informed about emerging trends in AI and cloud computing to recommend innovative solutions.
Translate technical AI concepts into actionable insights for stakeholders, including non-technical teams.
Support product teams in implementing AI-driven solutions and aligning them with business objectives.
Provide insights on AI products, data and AI governance, and emerging technology trends to colleagues and stakeholders through targeted workshops and “lunch and learn” sessions.
Participate in training sessions, conferences, and industry events to enhance professional growth.
Provide training sessions as trainer in our data & AI Academy.




Skills and Requirements

Proficiency in Python, SQL, and familiarity with machine learning libraries (e.g., scikit-learn, TensorFlow).
Experience with cloud technologies (Azure or AWS).
Proficiency in MLOps/DevOps best practices, including CI/CD pipelines, containerization, and monitoring tools.
Ability to manage AI and analytics projects with clear deliverables and KPIs.
Experience in AGILE development and cross-department collaboration.
Excellent communication skills to present AI insights to diverse stakeholders.
Familiarity with UI/UX design principles and tools like Mendix for integrating AI products into customer-facing applications.
Knowledge of financial regulations affecting AI, including the EU AI Act, GDPR and other data protection laws.




Preferred attitudes

Curiosity, humility and critical thinking.
Problem-solving mindset and willingness to adapt to new challenges.
Proactive, ethical, pragmatic and customer-focused.
Result-oriented with a strong focus on delivering high-quality outcomes for assigned tasks.

Education an Experience

Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or related field.

2–6 years of experience in AI or data science roles, preferably within the banking or financial industry.




Our Offer

A 100 % Belgian contract in Brussels.
Keytrade Bank is a young and dynamic organization with a lean structure, that evolves in an Agile ecosystem. The tempo and the atmosphere are upbeat and no day goes by without an element of fun!
The company works in an agile setup with a lot of flexibility regarding remote work. This means that you will be guaranteed at least 50% homework with a high degree of flexibility.
Offices are in Watermael-Boitsfort in a peaceful, green surrounding.
A competitive salary with extra-legal advantages such as meal vouchers, group insurance, health insurance and many others
Continued education and access to trainings
Stepping stone for a continued career within Keytrade Bank
Open, inclusive culture and dynamic working environment

Title: Applied AI Research Engineer
Description:
Company Goal:

We are committed to enhancing human potential through advanced robotics. Our goal is to revolutionize the manufacturing sector by introducing intelligent, adaptable robots that work alongside people and existing systems to drive superior quality, reduce waste, and cut costs.




Company Vision:

We envision a future where every step of the manufacturing process, from design to production, is optimized with smart automation. Our aim is to make flexible robotic solutions, powered by cutting-edge hardware and AI-driven software, accessible and economically viable for businesses of all sizes, particularly small and medium enterprises. We are not just creating robots; we are developing key building blocks for the autonomous, intelligent systems of the future.




The Role:

As an AI Research Engineer, you will be instrumental in exploring and deploying innovative AI technologies for our state-of-the-art robotics platform, with a focus on embodied AI.

This role provides an opportunity to tackle complex challenges and turn leading research into impactful, practical applications.




What you'll be responsible for:

Engage in research and development across the following domains:

Computer Vision: Improve perception capabilities for our monocular and stereo camera systems in targeted applications.
AI Models: Leverage advancements in foundational models to enable our robots to perform tasks intuitively and accurately.
Reinforcement Learning: Develop and implement effective control strategies for robotic manipulation.
Depth and Scene Analysis: Enhance perception capabilities with additional modalities such as depth estimation and 3D reconstruction from video.
Simulation-to-Reality: Enhance model deployment through synthetic data to close the gap between simulated environments and real-world performance.

Collaborate with engineering teams to translate research breakthroughs into practical solutions ready for deployment.




Your profile:

Demonstrated experience and knowledge in machine learning, deep learning, and computer vision.
Proven track record of applying research to solve challenging problems and deliver tangible outcomes.
Strong grasp of modern AI models and reinforcement learning methodologies.
Expertise in Python, with proficiency in frameworks such as PyTorch or TensorFlow.
Familiarity with multi-modal foundational models.
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and creative thinking skills.
Strong communication abilities to effectively convey ideas and present findings.
A strategic thinker with a pragmatic approach to decision-making and planning.




Essential experience:

Python programming
AI platforms such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, and Huggingface.
Experience with tools like Conda, Docker, Linux, Git, and project management platforms.
Experiment tracking and MLOps tools such as W&B, ClearML, or MLFlow.
Cloud platforms including AWS, GCE, or Azure for AI workflows.




Desirable experience:

Knowledge of advanced AI models.
Familiarity with robotics frameworks such as ROS/ROS2.
Exposure to AI agent-based systems.
Experience with hardware platforms like NVIDIA Jetson and AI acceleration tools.




Why Join Us?

Be part of an innovative company shaping the future of robotics and manufacturing.
Contribute to groundbreaking technology in an environment that values creativity and growth.
Competitive compensation package, including equity options, and a flexible work culture that fosters learning and excellence.

Title: AI Machine Learning Engineer - Brussels
Description:
YOUR JOB IN A NUTSHELL

As an AI Machine Learning Engineer you promote the adoption of best standards in industrial code development across the Machine Learning and AI community. You do so by developing ML pipelines that are production-ready by design or by integrating existing ML solutions into industrial pipelines.

You participate in the development, deployment and monitoring of AI services, which means you contribute to data quality checks, data flow design, the design of the models themselves and their overall integration into the production environment.

AND IN DETAIL


You facilitate the communication between AI & Analytics teams and IT production with regards to the deployment of ML models, ensuring that models put in production are equipped with the appropriate data pipelines and monitoring.
You work with the Data Scientists to define and develop the target solution with production constraints in mind. This allows to select the correct run infrastructure and serving model (e.g. data ingestion scheme, API synchronicity …) to address the business requirements (real-time responses, processing volumetry …).
You contribute to the automation of the different elements of the ML pipeline in order to integrate and deploy them in the production environment (e.g. building Docker/VM images, prepare unitary, regression and integration tests …).
You support Data Scientists on the usage of the existing industrial solutions available to build and monitor AI services (i.e. the CI/CD tools).
You support IT Production on the parameterization of the target environment.
You ensure that the model runs without errors, is retrained if needed (incl. automatically) and is monitored both from the IT and the business perspective.


YOUR TALENTS AND COMPETENCES


A profound knowledge of English is mandatory. Knowledge of Dutch and/or French is a plus.
You have at least 2 years of relevant experience with:
Basic knowledge of Linux platform
Containerization/virtualization
AI platforms & IDEs
CI/CD
Code, model & data versioning
Python
Usage of package managing tools and experience in dependency management
PostgreSQL
It is preferable you have experience with:
Integration using different technologies and infra components
Model compression techniques
ELT/ETL tools
Big data tools (Spark)
Data flow processing
Data visualization tools
You have a knowledge of agile methodology.
You have strong communication skills, oral and written. You are open to other’s opinions, ideas and feedback.
You work results driven, have attention to detail and you are a real problem solver. You can think out of the box and outside existing processes and frameworks.
You proactively invest time in continuous learning and knowledge improvement.
You work with energy and empowerment to deliver great results and a large contribution to the company’s success.


What We Have To Offer

OUR IMPACT

We strongly believe in the positive impact the financial sector can have on the world. BNP Paribas Fortis offers sustainable and responsible investment products and solutions, and encourages social entrepreneurship. Together with our customers, we work towards a better future every day.

YOUR CAREER PERSPECTIVES

We offer you a wide range of training courses, workshops and webinars to choose from depending on your availability, interests and ambitions.

OUR OFFER

You will benefit from our Smart Working program: offering flexibility on workplace (work everywhere, home working) and time management.

OUR ENGAGEMENT

At BNP Paribas Fortis, we want to attract and retain all talent, whatever their gender, age, background or sexual orientation, and irrespective of whether they are living with a disability, as every person has their own experiences and their own identity. All of our full-time vacancies are also open to candidates wishing to work on an 80% or 90% full-time equivalent basis.

TEMPTED BY THE CHALLENGE?

A first selection is made based on your CV and motivation letter. Are we convinced that you are the right candidate? Then we will contact you.

Good luck!

Is this position not for you, but do you know someone who is cut out for this job? Feel free to share it with friends and family!

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
AI Engineer - Remote - Up to $50K




I’m partnered with an innovative startup that’s building AI-driven solutions for the Financial Services sector, currently focused on delivering a groundbreaking product set to launch later this year. They’re building cutting-edge tools to solve complex problems in the world of qualitative equity research, and they need an AI Engineer to help make it happen.




We’re looking for someone with:




1-2 years of experience in AI/ML development.
Expertise in text extraction from PDFs, including OCR and natural language processing techniques.
Experience fine-tuning Large Language Models (LLMs) for specialised use cases.
Proficiency in Python, and familiarity with frameworks like TensorFlow or PyTorch.
Knowledge of NLP libraries such as spaCy, Hugging Face, or similar tools.




This is a unique opportunity to join an early-stage startup and make a real impact on the development of transformative products. You’ll work closely with a talented team, using cutting-edge technologies to solve real-world challenges in the financial industry.




If you’re passionate about AI and excited to make an impact, we’d love to hear from you! Apply now.

Improve our Deep Matching algorithm

Perfectly fluent in EN

Title: Research Engineer (Synthetic Data Generation)
Description:
Research Engineer - Synthetic Data Generation (LLMs)

Location: Remote




Are you passionate about pretraining foundational models and driving advancements in AI? We’re seeking a Research Engineer - Synthetic Data Generation to create and optimize datasets that power next-generation AI systems.




Key Responsibilities

Develop scalable synthetic data pipelines for pretraining large-scale foundational models.
Implement state-of-the-art generative AI techniques (e.g., GANs, diffusion models) to synthesize diverse, high-quality datasets.
Collaborate with research teams to align data generation strategies with pretraining objectives.
Evaluate and refine synthetic datasets to maximize their impact on model performance.




What We’re Looking For

Skills: Expertise in Python, PyTorch/TensorFlow, and generative models.
Experience: Proven track record in pretraining foundational models or synthetic data pipelines.
Qualifications: Bachelor’s, Master’s, or Ph.D. in AI/ML, Computer Science, or related fields.




Why Join Us?

Work on cutting-edge AI technologies and foundational model pretraining.
Be part of a team shaping the future of AI.
Competitive salary, benefits, and career growth opportunities.

Title: Research Scientist (Jr)
Description:
Position: Jr. Research Scientist

Location: Brussels/Leuven, Belgium




Role Overview

We seek a motivated Junior Research Scientist with a PhD (up to 2 years post-PhD) in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematical Engineering, or Operational Research.




Your Responsibilities

Develop novel methods and algorithms customized for solving network optimization problems involving nonlinear coupling constraints, nonconvex/nonlinear composite objective functions, etc.
Validate (numerically/experimentally) solutions using real-life datasets.
Integrate them as part of product-grade solver framework for automated execution.




Required Skills

Network optimization including network design, network embedding, routing/traffic assignment, resource allocation, flow/resource scheduling, etc.
Optimization Expertise: Mixed-integer nonlinear programming (mandatory) and iterative methods like quasi-Newton, primal-dual methods (Lagrangian methods, etc.), interior point, combinatorial methods: polyhedral methods, etc.
Programming: Proficiency in C/C++, Fortran, and Octave.
Tools: Good knowledge of MI(N)LP solving frameworks such as Gurobi, SCIP, Couenne/COIN-OR, SHOT/COIN-OR, Bonmin, etc. and subsolvers (e.g. MIP: CPlex, NLP: Ipopt, Conopt, Algencan).




Soft Skills

Attention to detail, adaptability, teamwork, and responsiveness.




Application Requirements

CV highlighting:
Programming: Outstanding programming skills (experimental code or ICPC winner) in C/C++ and Octave programming (programming skills in FORTRAN is considered as a plus)
Expertise in network optimization methods and algorithms: list of achievements and publications (Springer: JOTA, COAP, AMO, JGO, NUMA, etc. Wiley: Networks, IEEE JSAC, IEEE Transactions on Communications, etc.) –note: theoretical knowledge of abstract algorithms not sufficient
Languages: Proficiency in English (Dutch/Mandarin beneficial).

Application Requirements

  • CV highlighting:
  • Programming: Outstanding programming skills (experimental code or ICPC winner) in C/C++ and Octave programming (programming skills in FORTRAN is considered as a plus)
  • Expertise in network optimization methods and algorithms: list of achievements and publications (Springer: JOTA, COAP, AMO, JGO, NUMA, etc. Wiley: Networks, IEEE JSAC, IEEE Transactions on Communications, etc.) –note: theoretical knowledge of abstract algorithms not sufficient
  • Languages: Proficiency in English (Dutch/Mandarin beneficial).

Title: Senior ML Engineer
Description:
About Smartcat

Smartcat is on a mission to become the wall-to-wall Language AI platform, addressing the diverse needs in multilingual content for various user personas within global enterprises.

Smartcat is uniquely positioned within the $100+ billion multilingual content industry, which is currently served by tens of thousands of agencies. This results in a highly fragmented and inefficient supply chain, high costs, unacceptable turnaround times, and quality issues. Using highly qualified internal resources to translate or create multilingual content (insourcing) solves the quality problem for enterprises, but if done manually, it can't solve for scalability, high cost, and slow turnaround.

Smartcat changes the ROI equation in favor of insourcing with its Language AI platform for enterprise end-users. It delivers high-quality, instantaneous AI translations or generates new content in any language by tapping into a customer-specific multilingual content library. The AI output is further refined through human editing by the client's internal reviewers or experts from the Smartcat's embedded global marketplace of linguists and content editors. This AI output continuously improves through the editing feedback loop, ensuring consistent and customer-tailored results.

More than 1,000 global companies including ~20% of the Fortune 1,000 trust Smartcat to communicate their innovations and ideas all over the world.

As a dynamic Series C company, Smartcat is growing at 130% YoY, thanks to the high and quick ROI it delivers to global enterprises. It's well-funded by notable VCs, and is capital efficient, offering a unique blend of hyper-growth potential with downside protection and the capacity for long-term planning and strategy.

Mission

As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will be at the forefront of advancing our platform’s computer vision capabilities. Leveraging your expertise in machine learning including data curation, pipeline development, and model monitoring, you will deliver high-performance solutions that power critical features for our growing client base.

The ideal candidate possesses a broad range of expertise in machine learning (data labeling, training pipeline development, and model deployment/maintenance), as well as strong engineering skills. In this role, you will tackle complex challenges across our computer vision (CV) projects and play a key part in driving innovation by contributing to our cutting-edge Image and Video Translation products.

Requirements


Expertise in Computer Vision: experience delivering end-to-end CV projects (e.g., detection, segmentation, analysis, OCR, classification, video processing).
Foundational ML Skills: familiarity with classical ML techniques (e.g., clustering, boosting).
ML Lifecycle Knowledge: deep understanding of a machine learning project lifecycle.
Python Engineering: experience developing and maintaining Python microservices and libraries.
Ownership & Decision-Making: ability to work independently within a designated scope.


Key Responsibilities


Data Management: Coordinate data labeling efforts and curate high-quality datasets.
Model Development: Design, develop, and optimize ML training pipelines.
Deployment: Prepare models for production and contribute to deployment processes.
Monitoring & Maintenance: Oversee production models, ensuring proper performance through monitoring, fine-tuning, and troubleshooting.


Our technologies


ML: Python, Pytorch, Weights & Biases, Label-Studio
Databases: MongoDB, PostgreSQL, Elasticsearch
Messaging Queue: Apache Kafka
Cloud Provider: Amazon AWS
Monitoring & Logging: ELK (EFK), Prometheus, Grafana


Why joining Smartcat might be your best move so far


Fully remote team We are a global team of 200+ enthusiastic people spread across 30+ countries. We have been fully remote since 2020, with some locations populated with more Smartcaters than others, such as Boston, NYC, SF, the Bay Area, London, and Lisbon.
Innovating a $100 Billion industry Smartcat’s innovative approach towards multilingual content, taps into a $100B industry. Our platform enables enterprise end users to stop using traditional outsourcing methods, and start enjoying an easy-to-use, AI-powered SaaS, that delivers immediate high-quality results, at a fraction of the cost.
High impact role enabling innovation and inclusion in organizations You will enjoy building with us. You will drive changes in how an old-fashioned global language industry operates while improving how hundreds of thousands of people work and millions of people exchange knowledge and ideas worldwide.
Join the rocketship to scale-up 10x and beyond together We are looking for someone to become an integral part of our team and play a crucial role in the most exciting part of our journey: transitioning from a post-Series C startup to a company exceeding $100M in ARR and $1B in valuation. Our journey isn’t for the faint of heart. We are growing at 130% YoY, thanks to our strong product-market fit and high-performing team, and plan to accelerate from here.
Smartcat Culture: Where Diversity Meets High Performance At Smartcat, we are committed to building a culture that highlights respect and appreciation for each individual's unique background and perspective, while maintaining a strong focus on results and clear, honest and direct communication. We believe in welcoming everyone and fostering an inclusive environment where team members can be their authentic selves at work. Our commitment to diversity and inclusion is steadfast, and we stand firmly against discrimination and harassment.

Title: Python Developer (Freelance, 100% Remote)
Description:
ROLE OVERVIEW

12 Month Contract, Fully Remote, Well Known EU Client, ASAP Start

We are looking for a talented Python Developer to join our client's dynamic team. In this role, you will design, develop, and maintain high-quality Python applications that drive innovation and support business operations. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, leveraging Python’s power and flexibility to create scalable, efficient, and reliable solutions.




KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Write clean, efficient, and maintainable Python code.

Develop and deploy Python-based applications and services.

Collaborate with teams to define, design, and ship new features.

Integrate data storage solutions such as databases and cloud services.

Troubleshoot and debug applications to ensure optimal performance.

Write automated tests to ensure the quality and reliability of code.

Stay up-to-date with Python trends and best practices.

Participate in code reviews to maintain high code quality standards.




WHAT WILL MAKE US HAPPY ?

Proficiency in Python and related frameworks such as Django, Flask, or FastAPI.

Solid experience with databases like MySQL, PostgreSQL, or MongoDB.

Familiarity with web services and RESTful APIs.

Experience with version control tools, particularly Git.

Strong understanding of software engineering principles and problem-solving skills.

Knowledge of cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, or Azure).

Experience with Agile development methodologies.

Excellent communication skills and ability to work collaboratively.




NICE TO HAVE

Experience with front-end technologies (e.g., HTML, CSS, JavaScript).

Familiarity with containerization tools like Docker and Kubernetes.

Experience with testing frameworks like pytest or unittest.

Knowledge of CI/CD pipelines and DevOps practices.

Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
We are looking for..

a data scientist with a strong knowledge in machine and deep learning to strengthen the activities of our innovation team and Earth Observation activities. GIM uses an open innovation approach to respond flexibly to our rapidly changing ecosystem and to continuously renew our products and services portfolio.







Below you will not find a standard vacancy, you will read a short story about where you will make the difference. Do you want work with us on a society in which geospatial data empower people to live better lives and make better decisions? Get in touch!







As experienced data science professional

I am the driving force behind our Earth Observation AI developments that are used for the further extension of our Belmap product and on customer projects. I actively follow-up new developments and technologies in the data science / machine learning / deep learning & computer vision domains. I provide technical input for research proposals centered around AI for GEO and Earth Observation, and implement the resulting innovation projects.




I contribute to our excellent customer experience by supporting my sales colleagues on their customer visits and contribute to the (pre)sales process by thinking along with the customer, delivering technical advice and giving demos. Together with the team, I translate the customer needs into a concrete project strategy and set up an action plan to ensure the successful delivery of the customer solution. My fluency in Dutch (mandatory!) as well as English, is a big asset in this context. I keep an eye on the project agreements that were made regarding budget, planning and deadlines, and contribute to great project results. My experience with working on complex projects and my excellent communication skills ensure that we create win-win situations with our customers.




I keep up-to-date on the newest technical and scientific developments within the machine learning, Earth Observation and geotechnology domains and share my knowledge with my GIM colleagues. By continuously renewing this technological knowledge and applying it to rapidly evolving customer demands, I also help to ensure that GIMs' products and services portfolio continues to meet the future needs of customers.







What do we offer you?

At GIM we are convinced that employees make the difference. This is why we give them every opportunity to shine in a self-organizing context where we distribute clear areas of responsibility with lots of decision power. We offer you a versatile function in a dynamic and highly innovative company, excellent working conditions and real possibilities for career development. Our salary packages are market conform with excellent fringe benefits, and we give you the choice to opt for a mobility budget, fitting to your personal needs.

Show more

Title: Applied Machine Learning Research Engineer
Description:
Senior Applied Machine Learning Researcher - Distributed Model Training

Remote




We're hiring for a Machine Learning Researcher for a Series A start-up (over 50 million in funding and backed by top investors). The team are pushing the boundaries of machine learning research in a decentralized and heterogeneous environment. The mission is to train highly distributed models over uniquely decentralized infrastructure, revolutionizing the way neural networks are built and deployed.




Responsibilities:




Train models on decentralized and heterogeneous infrastructure, focusing on high-volume model training.
Serve as a bridge between researchers generating novel ideas and production engineers implementing them.
Manage and maintain experimental frameworks and test benches for ML research.
Provide engineering support, addressing reproducibility and other ML-related issues.
Follow best practices in design, testing, and documentation of code.
Publish research papers for top-tier AI conferences (NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR, AAAI, IJCAI) and collaborate with academic and research institutions.




Minimum Requirements:




Strong background in applied machine learning with hands-on experience in training models.
Proficient in building and managing distributed systems.
Strong coding skills with a focus on running experiments rather than developing novel concepts.
Comfortable working in a high-autonomy, unpredictable research environment.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.




Preferred Qualifications:




Experience with highly distributed model training.




Please apply for more details, we're looking forward to hearing from you

Show more

Title: internship in Data Science and AI Optimization
Description:
In a nutshell

Support Toyota’s Powertrain Division by enhancing Python algorithms, analyzing customer driving/charging behavior, and testing V2X usage impact. Ideal for data science/AI-focused students.

Company Information

TOYOTA is one of the world’s largest automobile manufacturers and a leading global corporation. Founded in 1937. Toyota now sells vehicles in 170 countries and employs over 350.000 people. Based in Brussels, Belgium, and staffed by 2.700 people and more than 60 nationalities, Toyota Motor Europe (TME) handles the wholesale marketing of Toyota and Lexus vehicles, parts & accessories, and manages Toyota’s European R&D, manufacturing, and engineering operations.

We are excited to be transforming into a mobility company focusing on bringing even more happiness to our customers through various mobility solutions.

Team/division Description

Your team and your responsibilities

As part of R&D organization, the Powertrain Division is responsible for local development of powertrains for vehicles built in one of the production plants, and for planning and research of new European technologies. Latest focus points include electrification, big data and connectivity.

Your project

R&D Is Building a Strong Focus On Developing & Using Big Data Techniques. Such Kind Of Big Data Techniques Include AI Optimization Methods. Included In The Connected Powertrain Department You Will


Understand, further develop & improve existing Python algorithms.
Analyse customer driving and charging style and propose scenarios of V2X usage.
Test methodologies for evaluate impact of V2X usage on durability and propose logics to protect the vehicle


Your Profile


You are fluent in English (TME’s business language)
Master of Science or equivalent student (ideally Statistical analysis/data science/ machine learning/ automotive).
You have a European EEA citizenship. (not requiring a visa to work in Belgium).
You must be a student for the entire duration of the internship.
Knowledge in computer programming, big data, machine learning.
Basic knowledge on V2G/V2H technologies.
Excellent knowledge of Python & Git.
Able to summarize and explain complex technical information in a clear and visual way.
You are a well organized and autonomous mindset person
Basic skills with Office suite is a must.


Starting date


March- April


Duration


6 months


Confidentiality

Due to business requirement, not all performed projects can be reflected in the internship report. This issue needs to be discussed with candidate/school in advance.

It is mandatory that applicants are students for the entire period of the internship.

We can only accept students with an EEA or Swiss citizenship (not requiring a work permit or visa to be eligible to perform an internship in Belgium)

We offer

We offer a dynamic multicultural work environment with broad opportunities to learn every day and exciting career pathways that help you explore different disciplines or areas of expertise.

Your benefits


Flexible working hours and hybrid working (homeworking, 10 days from abroad);
Company restaurant – Warm dishes, salads and desserts daily, including Japanese and traditional Belgian specialties, as well as a vegan/vegetarian option;
Sport facilities – Tennis, squash, volleyball, football and softball pitches are available at various Toyota sites;
Team building activities and other personnel related events;
Programs to support your physical and social well-being.


A truly diverse, equitable and inclusive workplace

At Toyota Motor Europe, we are committed to providing equal employment opportunity to all. All our recruitment decisions are based on the individual and their qualifications along with the job requirements. The selection process is without regard to nationality, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, religion, ethnicity, disability or other personal characteristics. We do not tolerate harassment or discrimination as our individual experiences and overall diversity is our key strength. Together we have the power to make a positive change and go beyond the ordinary.

If you need any specific consideration for the interview process due to disability or any other reason, please let the recruiter know.
